            "timestamp": 1705980271000,
            "title": "8% Ethereum Validators Went Down on Sunday, Sparking Worries on Client Diversity",
            "content": "<p>Reported by Coindesk, a bug in Ethereum's Nethermind client software – used by validators of the blockchain to interact with the network – knocked out a chunk of the chain's key operators on Sunday.</p><p>It was a manageable incident, but the episode revived a long-simmering debate in the Ethereum ecosystem around the need for \"client diversity.\" Some experts took the opportunity to point out how bad things could have been if another client software, Geth, the chain's most popular execution client, had gone out; the question is whether Ethereum could have kept going since Geth stands out as a possible single point of failure for the network.</p><p>Nethermind powers around 8% of the validators that operate Ethereum, and this weekend's bug was critical enough to pull those validators offline. Ethereum stayed up and running despite the issue, and Nethermind's developers released a patch fixing things within hours. The main consequence of the bug was that modest financial penalties fell onto some Nethermind-based validators.</p><p>Around 85% of Ethereum's validators are currently powered by Geth, and the recent outages to smaller execution clients have renewed concerns that Geth's dominant market position could pose grave consequences if there were ever issues with its programming.</p><p>Depending on the nature of the bug, a Geth glitch could halt the entire network, rendering it impossible for validators to add new blocks to the blockchain. Ethereum is also programmed to penalize validators that fall offline or break the network's rules, meaning thousands of Geth-based validators could be held financially liable in the event of a bug, and the penalties could get even bigger if the bug proves difficult to patch.</p>",
            "image_url": "https://s2.tokeninsight.com/static/news/cover/img/eth_staking2.png",

            "content": "<p>Reported by The Block, the Securities and Exchange Commission delayed its deadline to make a decision on Fidelity's proposal for a spot Ethereum exchange-traded fund until March 5, according to a filing on Thursday.</p><p>\"The Commission finds it appropriate to designate a longer period within which to take action on the proposed rule change so that it has sufficient time to consider the proposed rule change and the issues raised therein,\" the SEC said.</p><p>Fidelity applied for the Fidelity Ethereum Fund in November, noting in its proposal a court ruling last year where judges said the SEC failed to find a coherent reason on why it should reject spot crypto ETFs when it had allowed futures-based products.</p><p>Bloomberg Intelligence ETF analyst James Seyffart said the SEC's move to delay was expected. \"Fidelity #ethereum ETF delayed just now.             "timestamp": 1704955124000,
            "title": "Vitalik Buterin Advocates for Modest Gas Limit Increase to Enhance Ethereum Network Performance",
            "content": "<p>Vitalik Buterin, the co-founder of Ethereum, has called for a \"modest\" increase in the gas limit to potentially improve the network's throughput. Notably, the gas limit has remained unchanged for nearly three years, marking the longest period of stability in Ethereum's history.</p><p>Currently set at 30 million, Buterin proposes raising the gas limit to around 40 million, representing a 33% increase. Since the network's inception in 2015, the average gas limit has steadily risen from 3 million, reflecting the growing usage and adoption of Ethereum.</p><p>The gas limit refers to the maximum amount of gas that can be utilized for executing transactions or smart contracts within each block. This limit ensures that blocks maintain an optimal size, preventing any adverse impact on network performance and synchronization. Validators have the ability to dynamically adjust the gas limit within specific parameters while producing blocks.</p><p>By increasing the gas limit, more transactions can be included in each block, theoretically enhancing the overall throughput and capacity of the Ethereum network. However, this adjustment also places additional strain on hardware and raises concerns about potential network spam and attacks.</p>",
            "image_url": "https://s2.tokeninsight.com/static/news/cover/img/vitalik.png",

This sentiment rings true following a recent settlement between the U.S. Department of Justice and Binance, the leading crypto exchange.</p><p>Blockchain analytics firm Nansen has shed light on the crypto community’s reaction, revealing that despite significant legal developments involving Binance and its CEO Changpeng “CZ” Zhao, there hasn’t been a mass exodus of funds from the exchange.</p><p>The data from Nansen tells a story of steadfastness within the crypto community. In the 24 hours following the DOJ’s announcement of a $4.3 billion settlement with Binance, the exchange saw a net outflow of $956 million in Ethereum.</p><p>However, contrary to what one might expect, this did not lead to a dramatic drop in Binance’s holdings. Instances like the SEC suing Binance in June 2023, rumors of insolvency in December 2022, and the aftermath of the FTX incident all saw significant outflows.             "title": "Binance Settles Criminal Charges for $4.3 Billion, CZ Zhao Steps Down as CEO",
            "content": "<p>Binance has been charged with criminal offenses related to violating sanctions and money-transmitting laws. As part of the settlement, Binance has agreed to pay $4.3 billion to resolve the allegations. Additionally, CZ Zhao, the CEO of Binance, has pleaded guilty to the charges against him and will pay a $50 million fine. He has also agreed to step down from his position as CEO. Richard Teng, a former Abu Dhabi regulator and later Binance's regional markets head, will assume the role of CEO.</p><p>According to a court filing unsealed on Tuesday, Binance was accused of several violations, including the failure to maintain an adequate anti-money laundering program, operating an unlicensed money-transmitting business, and violating sanctions laws.</p><p>Under the terms of the plea agreement, Binance will be required to appoint an independent compliance monitor for a period of three years. The company will also need to report its compliance efforts to the U.S. Government. CZ Zhao is prohibited from any present or future involvement in the operation or management of Binance.</p><p>As part of his agreement, CZ Zhao will pay a $175 million release bond and commit to returning to the U.S. 14 days prior to his sentencing scheduled for February 23, 2024. He has also agreed to provide the court with his residence information, and a warrant could be issued for his arrest if he fails to appear for his court date.</p>",

            "content": "<p>Rune Christensen, the founder of <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/coins/makerdao/overview\">MakerDAO</a>, has initiated a community proposal regarding the 'SparkDAO SPK pre-farming airdrop; general SubDAO farming overview.' The proposal outlines the potential SPK pre-farming airdrop plan for the lending protocol Spark Protocol and reviews the general SubDAO farming economic model, which is set to launch in the second phase.</p><p>The proposal suggests retroactively calculating which users have borrowed from the Spark Protocol and starting the calculation from the moment when the borrowing interest rate was raised to 5%. Token distribution will be based on the proportion of the volatile assets they have collateralized and the duration of time. Users will be eligible for the airdrop without taking any specific action.</p><p>Over a span of 10 years, a total of 2 billion SubDAO tokens will be distributed to each SubDAO participant. In the first two years, the initial farming rate is 500 million SubDAO tokens annually, with 350 million SubDAO tokens allocated for NewStable yield farmers and 150 million SubDAO tokens allocated for NewGovToken yield farmers each year.</p><p>For the following two years (third to fourth year), the initial farming rate reduces to 250 million SubDAO tokens annually, with 175 million SubDAO tokens allocated for NewStable yield farmers and 75 million SubDAO tokens allocated for NewGovToken yield farmers each year.</p><p>MakerDAO's End Game plan involves breaking down the existing DAO structure into smaller autonomous entities called SubDAOs. These entities are autonomous and self-sustaining, each having their own tokens within the MakerDAO ecosystem.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/cryptocurrencies\">TokenInsight</a> is dedicated to covering the most important and cutting-edge trends in the world of crypto.             "content": "<p>Spark Protocol, <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/coins/makerdao/overview\">MakerDAO</a>'s lending protocol, has raised the <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/coins/daidai/overview\">Dai</a> Savings Rate (DSR) to 8%, meaning that users are able to earn an 8% APY when depositing $DAI. This causes the Enhanced DSR system to increase the rate to attract more users. Once more users arrive, the rate will go back down,\" he explained.</p><p>It's worth mentioning that Spark Protocol is not available for US or VPN users, which is heavily criticized by the crypto community. The tokens affected include ETH, USDC, WETH, USDT, DAI, WBTC, agEUR, GUSD, LUSD, EUROC and XSGD, Uniswap said Monday on its <a rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\" target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://support.uniswap.org/hc/en-us/articles/20131678274957-What-are-Uniswap-Labs-fees\">website</a>.</p><p>For the fee to apply, both input and output tokens need to be on the list.</p><p>The interface fees will be deducted from the output token amount.             "timestamp": 1693451999000,
            "title": "US Judge Rules that Uniswap Not Responsible for Third Parities' Bad Behaviors",
            "content": "<p>US Judge Rules that Uniswap Not Responsible for Third Parities' Bad Behaviors on Protocol</p><p>Judge Katherine Polk Failla of the US District Court for the Southern District of New York dismissed a class action complaint against <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/coins/uniswap/overview\">Uniswap</a> and Paradigm alleging that Uniswap should be responsible for the losses caused by scam tokens on the protocol. The judge ruled that protocol developers cannot be held accountable for the losses of the users or the damage caused by third parties.</p><p>Uniswap compared the plaintiffs' point of view to \"an effort to hold a developer of self-driving cars liable for a third party's use of the car to commit a traffic violation or to rob a bank\". The judge found that there were no transactions between the plaintiffs and the Uniswap platform or Uniswap Labs, and the current securities laws do not reach the liability of the DeFi protocol itself for the actions of people using it to defraud others.</p><p>Following the ruling, Uniswap founder Hayden Adams said on X, \"Huge win, long live DeFi. One longtime fear of mine has been bad legal interpretation of our complex, technical industry. It's highly motivating to see US courts hold up arguments I've felt deeply for years.\"</p><p>It's worth mentioning that Judge Katherine Polk Failla believed $ETH is a commodity instead of a security in her decision in the case. She is also in charge of the SEC against Coinbase case.</p><p><img src=\"https://s2.tokeninsight.com/static/calendar/img2023083111162760052f03-bc8d-48c4-88c7-c074ac464f6e.jpg\"></p><ul><li>Stay updated with the most important <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/news\">cryptocurrency news</a> and valuable insights, conveniently delivered to your email every day. <a rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\" target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://mailchi.mp/tokeninsight/newsletter\">Subscribe to the TokenInsight mailing list now!</a></li><li>Prefer social media?             "title": "Chainlink Integrated with Circle's CCTP with its own CCIP Cross Chain System",
            "content": "<p>Chainlink announced it has integrated Circle's cross-chain transfer protocol (CCTP) with its own CCIP system, aiming to securely move the USDC stablecoin across chains.</p><p>Chainlink said leveraging both technologies will open up new stablecoin use cases around payments and DeFi. “We’re excited to support the adoption of stablecoins across a variety of cross-chain use cases,” said Sergey Nazarov, co-founder at Chainlink.</p><p>Chainlink’s CCIP is a generalized cross-chain messaging framework that allows developers to transfer data and assets across chains — using a smart contract-based mechanism that's powered by Chainlink oracles.</p><p>Meanwhile, Circle — the issuer of USDC — operates CCTP. This is a standardized bridge protocol that lets users make native USDC transfers by burning and minting the stablecoin between supported chains.</p>",

            "title": "Chanlink to Open $LINK Staking v0.2 with Pool Size Reach 45M $LINK",
            "content": "<p>Chainlink will open LINK staking v0.2, and the staking v0.2 pool size will reach 45 million LINK (worth approximately $650 million), of which 40.875 million LINK will be allocated to the community and the rest will be allocated to Chainlink node operators. Community members can stake 1-15,000 LINK, and node operators can stake 1,000-75,000 LINK.</p><p>Staking provides Chainlink ecosystem participants with the opportunity to earn rewards for increasing the security guarantees and user assurances of oracle services by backing them with staked LINK tokens. Chainlink Staking initially launched with v0.1 and is evolving with the upcoming v0.2 upgrade.</p><p>Stakers gain access to staking rewards for securing the network through timely and valid alerts, and in the future, for slashing and loss protection.</p>",

            "title": "Cosmos Hub Approved Proposal to Reduce $ATOM Inflation From 14% to 10%",
            "content": "<p>The Cosmos Hub community has approved the proposal to decrease the maximum inflation rate of $ATOM token from 14% to 10%. Annual staking yield for ATOM will also reduce from around 19% to 13.4%.</p><p>The proposal was narrowly passed, with 41.1% of votes for and 38.5% of votes against. The proposal deemed that ATOM's elevated inflation rate resulted in the Comos Hub overspending on secrurity. It also argued that validators could still achieve breakeven or profitability with inflation reduced to 10%.</p><p>Zero Knowledge Validator casted the largest vote in favor of the proposal, it explained:\"Double digit inflation is not necessary for security, weakens ATOM price long term, and disincentivizes use of ATOM in DeFi and elsewhere in the ATOM Economic Zone.\"</p>",

            "timestamp": 1700116769000,
            "title": "Cosmos Community Voting to Reduce $ATOM Inflation Rate from 20% to 10%",
            "content": "<p>The Cosmos community has initiated a vote on the ATOM halving proposal, aiming to reduce the maximum inflation parameter of ATOM from 20% to 10%. This proposal, if accepted, will result in a notable drop in the current inflation rate, decreasing from approximately 14% to 10%. Additionally, the staking Annual Percentage Rate (APR) is expected to decline from around 19% to approximately 13.4%.</p><p>Research conducted by Blockworks Research has indicated that ATOM may be overpaying for security, prompting the suggestion to transition to a set supply schedule. According to their findings, nearly all 180 validators are either breaking even or turning a profit at a 10% maximum inflation rate, supported solely by commission. Validators also have the option to increase their commission rate to help cover operational expenses.</p><p>As the voting process unfolds, 40.8% of the voters have rejected the proposal, while 36.9% have voted in favor. A minimal 1.3% have voted no with a veto, indicating a strong rejection of the proposal. The remaining participants have chosen to abstain from voting. The voting period is set to conclude on November 26th.</p>",

            "title": "Liquid Staking Protocol Stride Proposes to Convert Entire $STRD Supply to $ATOM",
            "content": "<p>Cosmos-based liquid staking protocol <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/coins/stride/overview\">Stride</a> released a governance proposal in the <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/coins/cosmosatom/overview\">Cosmos Hub</a> forum, proposing to convert the entire supply of its token $STRD to $ATOM and use $ATOM as the new governance token to increase the decentralization of the protocol.</p><p>If the proposal got approved, Cosmos Hub would provision an amount of $ATOM for the conversion and receive 100% of the Stride protocol rewards. The Stride blockchain would become a satellite chain of Cosmos Hub. Stride contributors would continue working on Stride protocol, as well as helping out with Cosmos Hub.</p><p>\"Given the decentralization, maturity, and neutrality of ATOM, it would be a more trusted governance token for Stride protocol, likely leading to an increased adoption of liquid staking,\" Stride said in the proposal.</p><p>The proposal is still in an early stage, and the conversion rate hasn't been decided. According to the Stride team, protocol contributors and investors would be subject to a vesting schedule, preventing them from immediately selling their $ATOM.</p><p><img src=\"https://s2.tokeninsight.com/static/calendar/img202310110701495503f0c7-6024-4da2-8eee-b704445c63eb.jpg\"></p><p>Stay updated with the most important <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/news\">cryptocurrency news</a> and valuable insights, conveniently delivered to your email every day. <a rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\" target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://mailchi.mp/tokeninsight/newsletter\">Subscribe to the TokenInsight mailing list now!</a></p><p>Prefer social media?             "content": "<p>TokenInsight released Crypto Exchange Report 2023Q3. The report selected the Top10 centralized exchanges and summarized their data performance, aiming to help users understand the changes in the exchange market.</p><p>The report shows that in Q3, the total trading volume of Top10 exchanges was $6.1 trillion, a 23% decrease from $8.3 trillion in Q2. Coincidentally, the second quarter's trading volume also dropped 23% from Q1's $10.4 trillion. If this trend continues, the total trading volume in Q4 will be less than $5 trillion. It's worth noting that the total trading volume of Top10 exchanges in September was only $1.67 trillion, the lowest in the past year. In addition, the spot trading volume of the Top10 spot exchanges was $1 trillion, down 24.4% from Q2; the derivatives trading volume of the Top10 derivatives exchanges was $5.2 trillion, down 22.4%.</p><p><img src=\"https://s2.tokeninsight.com/static/calendar/img20231018103051f8701034-fc83-4945-823c-b4b933da64e2.jpg\"></p><p>Binance's total trading volume in Q3 was $3.2 trillion. Although its market share decreased by 1.87% compared to the previous quarter, it's still in the leading position with a 53.4% market share. Exchanges such as OKX, Bybit, Bitget, and Coinbase achieved market share growth in the quarter.</p><p>Among the six exchanges that provide both spot and derivatives services, only Gate maintains a relatively high spot trading volume share of more than 30% (32%).             "content": "<p>Reported by Cointelegraph, Avalanche-based memecoins wanting a slice of a $100 million fund must be at least one month old, among other newly unveiled criteria from the Avalanche Foundation, which recently expanded the scope of its fund to capture what it calls “community coins.”</p><p>In a Jan. 23 blog post, the Avalanche Foundation handed down a range of flexible criteria for its memecoin picks for its $100 million “Culture Catalyst” fund — initially launched to invest in nonfungible token artists.</p><p>It said all eligible meme tokens must have their contracts renounced, possess a low ownership concentration among whales and have high levels of liquidity, among other requirements.</p><p>The foundation noted many of its criteria were flexible, but it had firm minimum eligibility requirements, including a minimum of 2,000 unique holders, at least $200,000 in liquidity from 50 different providers, and the project “should be in existence for at least one month.”</p><p>The foundation’s initial announcement that its fund expanded to include memecoins in late December 2023 was met with raised eyebrows from market commentators, with some deriding the organization for its “desperate and unbecoming” move.</p><p>Despite the backlash, the Avalanche Foundation revealed it had “already started” using its Culture Catalyst program to deploy capital into “community coins.”</p>",

            "title": "Stars Arena Recovers 90% of Stolen Funds, Has Written New Contract",
            "content": "<p><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/coins/avalanche/overview\">Avalanche</a>-based SocialFi protocol Stars Arena announced it has reached an agreement with the protocol attacker, recovering over 239K $AVAX, which is approximately 90% of the lost funds.             "content": "<p>Stars Arena, a friend.tech-like SocialFi app on <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/coins/avalanche/overview\">Avalanche</a>, announced it has secured the resources to close the gap caused by the previous exploit, and its smart contract will be re-opened after a full security audit.</p><p>Previously, a security hole was found in the Stars Arena contract. Though the team said the issue had been fixed, it was exploited yesterday, and around $3 million was stolen. After the incident, the crypto community suspected that it was a rug pull, and some people questioned the relationship between the project and Avalanche. But Stars Arena said, \"A special white hat development team is coming in to rapidly review the security of the platform. We will re-open the contract with all the funds in full after a full security audit. This will happen very soon.\" adding, \"We're not going anywhere.\"</p><p>Emin Gün Sirer, founder of Avalanche, also expressed his support for the project. He clarified that the project was built by the Builder and the Arena team, and it was \"a fantastic product that has proven its virality in the market.\" The losses were \"only $3m\", and he was \"confident that the hole will be plugged\".</p><p>He said, \"Stars Arena is a profitable service that makes money. The amount lost, $3m, is something that SA can recover in about 10 days or so. Worst case, the team can borrow $3m and pay it back with interest.</p><p>\"Remember that Wormhole got hacked for $300m and is still around. Axie Infinity lost $625m and is still around. SA will definitely be around. There are some haters out there, which is a testament to SA's success. With its payment core based on Tokenized Money, TOPOS aims to allow users to mint money and transfer value in a controlled and secure manner in Web3.</p><p>Anyone can assemble the final payment and clearing service in the ecosystem through the underlying blockchain capabilities provided by TOPOS. Merchants and users can hold Web3 assets in a non-custodial manner and make payments and exchange value in accordance with the standards developed by acquiring institutions, wallet institutions, and Tokenized Money payment scenario standard setters.</p><p>TOPOS aims to build a multi-party payment and clearing architecture based on multi-party consensus with global developers, issuing institutions, acquiring institutions, wallets, and other third-party specialized service institutions under the global regulatory compliance framework.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/cryptocurrencies\">TokenInsight</a> is dedicated to covering the most important and cutting-edge trends in the world of crypto.             "content": "<p><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/coins/0x/overview\">0x</a> Labs announced the beta launch of their Tx Relay API on both <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/coins/polygon/overview\">Polygon</a> and <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/coins/ethereum/overview\">Ethereum</a>, making it easier for developers to create frictionless crypto experiences.</p><p>One of the key problems with Web3 is the need for users to hold and maintain balances for each chain’s native token to pay for transactions, which can be a significant barrier to adoption. With the Tx Relay API, developers can now build more intuitive user interfaces for their applications, allowing for easier onboarding of new users into Web3.</p><p>The Robinhood Wallet is the first partner to leverage the Tx Relay API. Robinhood Wallet will be able to offer a more streamlined and user-friendly experience for its users.             "content": "<p>Reported by The Block, one of the key node operators for Lido Finance, InfStones, will temporarily withdraw its Ethereum validators from the liquid staking protocol and implement key rotations in response to a significant vulnerability revealed by dWallet Labs' security researchers.</p><p>The vulnerability, linked to the open-source library Tailon, was reported to InfStones in July 2023 and has since been resolved. Nonetheless, this event has led to the adoption of preventative security measures.</p><p>Lido Finance confirmed the vulnerability was related to potential root-level access that impacted 25 of InfStones’ validator servers. Lido clarified, however, that there’s no evidence of any key leakage or exploitation as a result of this issue.</p><p>\"To clarify: There is currently no indication of key leakage or compromise, and the vulnerability may not affect validators related the Lido protocol,\" it said.</p><p>In its security report, dWallet Labs alleged the vulnerability could have potentially triggered a security breach impacting the ETH staked through InfStones’ nodes on Lido. Consequently, the firm recommended the rotation of validator keys for all nodes that were possibly exposed to the vulnerability.</p><p>InfStones said the issue flagged by dWallet only affected a small part of its infrastructure, with less than 0.1% of its systems via a specific network port on its network that had the issue.           {
            "timestamp": 1700185608000,
            "title": "Polygon Network Experienced Unprecedented Surge in Transactions Caused by Ordinals-like Tokens",
            "content": "<p>The Polygon network has witnessed an unprecedented surge in daily transactions, leading to a substantial rise in gas fees over the past 24 hours.</p><figure class=\"image\"><img src=\"https://s2.tokeninsight.com/static/calendar/img2023111709464222fac2b8-0bdb-409b-b753-ddbea4b0e6ca.jpg\" alt=\"Polygon\"></figure><p>This heightened network activity has resulted in a notable increase in transaction costs, with average fees soaring to over 7,000 Gwei, up from 100 Gwei just a day earlier. Token swaps on the chain peaked at $5 for simple swaps but have since receded to under $0.5.</p><p>The surge in activity can be attributed to a novel category of tokens known as \"PRC-20,\" inspired by the Ordinals token standards on Bitcoin. Users have been prolifically minting PRC-20 tokens, specifically named POLS. Notably, these tokens are created using transactional calldata on the Polygon blockchain, deviating from the conventional ERC-20 token standard.</p><p>This unique mechanism draws inspiration from Ordinals, a protocol designed for generating tokens and NFTs on the Bitcoin network. The process, termed \"inscription,\" assigns data to individual satoshis across the Bitcoin network. In contrast, Polygon-based PRC-20s employ a distinct strategy, utilizing transaction calldata to generate tokens or unique NFT-like image artifacts embedded within the network transactions.</p>",

            "title": "Polygon Releases Three Proposals on 2.0 Upgrade",
            "content": "<p>Polygon Labs has released three <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/coins/polygon/overview\">Polygon</a> 2.0 Upgrade Proposals (PIPs) that detail the outline of the transition, specifications for the upgraded Polygon 2.0 architecture, and updates to its native tokens. These proposals will be implemented upon approval via a governance vote. The final Polygon 2.0 upgrade is expected to take place next year.</p><p>Among the three proposals, PIP-17 outlines \"Phase 0\" of Polygon 2.0. The main aspect of the proposal is to ensure that end-users and developers do not have to take any action on existing Polygon PoS and Polygon zkEVM chains during the upgrade.</p><p>PIP-18 proposes the deployment of POL tokens, which are intended to replace the existing MATIC tokens as the native Gas and staking asset of the Polygon ecosystem.</p><p>PIP-19 proposes to upgrade the native Gas token on Polygon PoS from MATIC to POL. This ensures that the token upgrade does not change the smart contracts on Polygon PoS in terms of compatibility. The goal is to ensure upgraded POL token's code properties remain the same.</p><p><img src=\"https://s2.tokeninsight.com/static/calendar/img202309141116000d2b52a3-7469-4216-a708-894730bef0ac.jpg\"></p><p>Stay updated with the most important <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/news\">cryptocurrency news</a> and valuable insights, conveniently delivered to your email every day. <a rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\" target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://mailchi.mp/tokeninsight/newsletter\">Subscribe to the TokenInsight mailing list now!</a></p><p>Prefer social media?             "content": "<p>The NEAR Foundation, a non-profit organization driving the development of the <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/zh/coins/near-protocol/overview\">NEAR</a> protocol ecosystem, has teamed up with Alibaba Cloud, the computing and storage arm of Chinese tech giant Alibaba, to accelerate Web 3 growth in Asia and the Middle East. The partnership will provide the NEAR Foundation with access to Alibaba Cloud's developer ecosystem, enabling them to attract more developers to build on the NEAR protocol.</p><p>According to the NEAR Foundation, developers who wish to launch new NEAR validators will be able to do so using Alibaba Cloud's \"plug-and-play\" infrastructure as a service. The partnership will also offer remote procedure calls (RPC) as a service to developers and users in the NEAR ecosystem, allowing them to read data on blockchains and send transactions to different networks.</p><p>Moreover, the partnership will provide multi-chain indexing to offer data query API to developers. Users will also be able to use the NEAR Blockchain Operating System (BOS) while utilizing Alibaba Cloud's infrastructure.</p><p>This move follows Alibaba's recent hiring of its new Chairman, Joseph Tsai, who has signed multiple deals with crypto-related entities and is an active Web 3 investor.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/cryptocurrencies\">TokenInsight</a> is dedicated to covering the most important and cutting-edge trends in the world of crypto. The protocol outsources routing and batching to a permissionless set of fillers, and uses Permit2 executable off-chain signatures, allowing gasless trading, MEV protection, cross-chain trading, and more. To learn more about UniswapX, please check out TokenWiki: <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/tokenwiki/all/what-is-uniswapx\">What is UniswapX | TokenInsight</a></p><p>UniswapX quickly drew loads of attention from the crypto community, as well as criticism. Someone thought that the aggregator mechanism of UniswapX was nothing new, and its fillers had the same function as <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/coins/cow-protocol/overview\">Cow Swap</a>'s solver model.</p><p>When Dan Robinson, Head of Research at <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/capitals/paradigm\">Paradigm</a> and contributor of Uniswap, shared the five reasons he thought \"UniswapX changes the game for decentralized exchange, MEV, and interoperability\" on Twitter, <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/coins/curve-finance/overview\">Curve Finance</a> commented, \"Dan, with all respect. The game was changed long ago by <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/coins/1inch/overview\">1inch</a> when they first did high-quality aggregation and Cow Swap when they pioneered the solver model. It's good stuff, but you are not really the first or the second.\"</p><p>Interestingly, the two projects Curve mentioned, 1inch and Cow Swap, both mocked UniswapX by memes.             "timestamp": 1688604289000,
            "title": "1inch Sold 11,000 $ETH to Test Fusion Mode, Says Co-Founder",
            "content": "<p>At around 1pm UTC on July 5, an address belonging to <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/coins/1inch/overview\">1inch</a> sold approximately 11,000 <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/coins/ethereum/overview\">$ETH</a>, which raised concerns within the crypto community. According to The Block, 1inch co-founder Sergej Kunz confirmed that the transactions were to test the DEX aggregator's Fusion Mode.</p><p>1inch swapped the 11,000 $ETH to <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/coins/daidai/overview\">$DAI</a>, then to MakerDAO's interest bearing token $CHAI. Kunz said, \"our team is testing the new feature in Fusion mode. It's possible to use custom preset to set duration, start and end auction amount. This kind of strategy is very helpful for rebalancing assets (for DAOs, Hedge and Investment Funds). Based on the results, the trade was executed with better average rate compared to just a market swap.\"</p><p>Additionally, in response to a comment on Twitter, Kunz said 1inch would also test \"in reverse direction\", which is to buy back $ETH below the on-chain market price using Fusion Mode.</p><p>1inch rolled out the Fusion upgrade last December to enhance its swap engine, connecting users to liquidity providing professional market makers. The upgrade aimed to allow more cost-efficient transactions with added security.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/cryptocurrencies\">TokenInsight</a> is dedicated to covering the most important and cutting-edge trends in the world of crypto.             "content": "<p>Binance NFT will be discontinuing <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/coins/the-sandbox/overview\">The Sandbox</a> NFT Staking Program on September 26, 2023 at 6:00 UTC.&nbsp;</p><p>Effective from 06:00 UTC on September 26, 2023, users will not be able to stake LAND NFTs hosted on the <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/coins/polygon/overview\">Polygon</a> Network on Binance NFT Marketplace to earn daily The Sandbox (SAND) rewards. The last daily SAND rewards will also be automatically distributed to users’ Spot wallets after 2:00 UTC on September 28.</p><p>Additionally, Binance NFT will be removing support for Polygon Network from 06:00 UTC on September 26, 2023 onward. Users should withdraw their NFTs via the Polygon Network from Binance NFT Marketplace by 11:59 UTC on December 31, 2024.</p><p>From 6:00 UTC on September 26, 2023, users may not be able to buy, deposit, offer or list NFTs from the Polygon Network on Binance NFT Marketplace.             "title": "US SEC Suffers Third Consecutive Loss as It Dropped Charges Against Ripple Executives ",
            "content": "<p><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/coins/ripple/overview\">Ripple</a> announced that the US Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) had dismissed the charges against Ripple CEO Brad Garlinghouse and co-founder and Executive Chairman Chris Larsen. A trial originally scheduled for April 2024 is also canceled.</p><p>\"This is not a settlement. This is a surrender by the SEC,\" said Ripple CLO Stuart Alderoty, adding that this was the third consecutive win for Ripple against the SEC. <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/news/us-judge-rules-xrp-is-not-security-xrp-went-up-by-23.37-in-last-hour\">The first win</a> was in July when Judge Analisa Torres ruled that Ripple's programmatic sales and other distributions of $XRP did not constitute offers and sales of securities, and <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/news/u.s.-judge-rejected-the-sec-s-motion-to-appeal-xrp-rulling-in-ripple-case\">the second </a>was in early October when Judge Torres denied the SEC's bid for an interlocutory appeal against the decision above.</p><p>Ripple CEO Garlinghouse celebrated his victory on X, saying, \"In all seriousness, Chris and I (in a case involving no claims of fraud or misrepresentations) were targeted by the SEC in a ruthless attempt to personally ruin us and the company so many have worked hard to build for over a decade.</p><p>\"The SEC repeatedly kept its eye off the ball while secretly meeting with the likes of SBF – failing again and again to protect US consumers &amp; businesses.             "title": "Ripple CTO Seeks Community Consensus for $XRP's Protocol Native AMM",
            "content": "<p><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/coins/ripple/overview\">Ripple‘s</a> Chief Technology Officer, David Schwartz, has called on validators within the XRP Ledger community to consider adopting an automated market maker (AMM) feature. However, he emphasizes that this adoption should only occur if a consensus is reached within the community. In a recent discussion on the social media platform X (formerly Twitter), Schwartz highlighted the potential benefits of integrating AMMs into the XRPL.</p><p>In early 2022, Ripple proposed a novel AMM design for the XRP Ledger. It has subsequently been implemented on a devnet, with a mainnet launch being contingent upon governance approval. Unlike traditional AMMs, such as those on Ethereum, it integrates directly into the XRP ledger itself as a core primitive.</p><p>This AMM is a protocol-native AMM, which means that liquidity is shared at a blockchain level, and it is easy for developers to integrate AMM functionality into their projects, removing pain points such as liquidity bootstrapping.</p><p><img src=\"https://s2.tokeninsight.com/static/calendar/img20231009100239dc4801c9-9004-4bc3-b37a-9f7ba25b626f.jpg\"></p><p>Stay updated with the most important <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/news\">cryptocurrency news</a> and valuable insights, conveniently delivered to your email every day. <a rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\" target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://mailchi.mp/tokeninsight/newsletter\">Subscribe to the TokenInsight mailing list now!</a></p><p>Prefer social media?             "content": "<p>In an Oct.3 court order, the U.S. District Judge Analisa Torres has rejected the SEC's motion to appeal its loss against <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/coins/ripple/overview\">Ripple Labs</a>, claiming that the regulator failed to meet its burden to show that there were controlling questions of law or that there were substantial grounds for differences of opinion on the matter.</p><p>In July, Judge Analisa Torres from the Southern District Court of New York ruled that Ripple's programmatic sales and other distributions of XRP did not constitute offers and sales of securities.             "content": "<p>According to the TokenInsight Dashboard, multiple altcoins had an obvious increase in the market liquidity depth at major exchanges before yesterday's price jump.</p><p>Among the altcoins, <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/coins/litecoin/overview\">LTC</a> had one of the most significant buying order increases. Starting from 9 am UTC yesterday, the depth of LTC buying orders began to increase, suddenly rising from around $3.5 million, which had lasted for a long time, to more than $5 million. Correspondingly, the selling orders also increased. The price of LTC then started going up a few hours later.</p><p><img src=\"https://s2.tokeninsight.com/static/calendar/img2023090804482358b13f37-12b4-4eae-a338-c4f2fc803f02.jpg\"></p><p>Before the price of <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/coins/ripple/overview\">XRP</a> began to rise from 2 pm UTC yesterday, its buying orders increased from $5.3 million at 8 am to more than $8 million at 10 am.</p><p><img src=\"https://s2.tokeninsight.com/static/calendar/img20230908044824cf3156a0-a116-4712-9a1b-4e83a70550c0.jpg\"></p><p>Similar to LTC and XRP, the bid orders of <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/coins/solana/overview\">SOL</a> and <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/coins/sui/overview\">SUI</a> have also increased significantly since around 9 am UTC yesterday. SOL's buying orders increased by more than $1.2 million in one hour, while SUI almost doubled its bids, from $760K to $1.46 million. This is the first time since August 25 that SUI's buying orders exceeded $1 million. A few hours later, the prices of SOL and SUI also went up.</p><p><img src=\"https://s2.tokeninsight.com/static/calendar/img20230908044824c815f067-3d96-4c98-8001-dc2906594eef.jpg\"></p><p><img src=\"https://s2.tokeninsight.com/static/calendar/img202309080448255f44e5ef-4f03-48aa-ace9-fa46ebfc4ba4.jpg\"></p><p>TokenInsight Dashboard has added the exchange aggregated orderbook liquidity data of 7 altcoins, which are XRP, SOL, SUI, DOGE, BNB, LTC, and MATIC. The aggregated depth chart of the tokens' bid and ask orders is obtained by aggregating the depth within a 1% price range from the five exchanges with the best liquidity: <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/exchanges/binance\">Binance</a>, <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/exchanges/coinbase\">Coinbase</a>, <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/exchanges/kraken\">Kraken</a>, <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/exchanges/bitfinex\">Bitfinex</a>, and <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/exchanges/kucoin\">KuCoin</a>. If you want to understand the specific selection rules for each trading pair on these exchanges, data calculation rules, and how to interpret the above chart, check <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/tokenwiki/all/what-is-order-book-liquidity-how-can-you-compare-liquidity-data-from-major-exchanges-through-tokeninsight\">Learn what liquidity is, methodology of data calculation, and how to read the charts.</a></p><p>It's important to note that there are many factors influencing the price of cryptocurrencies, and while individual order book data can reflect certain factors, it cannot be the sole consideration. Changes in the depth of ask and bid orders in the order book may directly impact subsequent prices, but they can also be influenced by price fluctuations.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><ul><li>Stay updated with the most important <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/news\">cryptocurrency news</a> and valuable insights, conveniently delivered to your email every day. <a rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\" target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://mailchi.mp/tokeninsight/newsletter\">Subscribe to the TokenInsight mailing list now!</a></li><li>Prefer social media?             "content": "<p><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/coins/trust-wallet-token/overview\">Trust Wallet</a> has introduced a new security feature that utilizes Multi-Party Computation (MPC) technology, in collaboration with Web3Auth. This feature eliminates the need for users to write down a seed phrase, reducing the risk of human error and single point of failure, and enhancing account safety and security.</p><p>With this new feature, users can quickly and easily access Trust Wallet services using their existing social media accounts, such as Google, Apple, Telegram, and Discord, which simplifies onboarding for new Web3 users.             "title": "Trust Wallet to Reimburse Users affected by the Security Vulnerability",
            "content": "<p><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/coins/trust-wallet-token/overview\">Trust Wallet</a> has announced that it will reimburse users who lost funds in a security incident that resulted in nearly $170,000 in losses. The company discovered the vulnerability in November 2022, after a security researcher reported a WebAssembly vulnerability in the open-source library Wallet Core. The issue impacted wallet addresses created through the browser extension between November 14 and 23, 2022, and resulted in two exploits that led to a total loss of nearly $170,000.</p><p>Approximately 500 vulnerable addresses remain, with an $88,000 balance, according to a report. Trust Wallet has urged affected users to move the remaining balance on all vulnerable addresses as soon as possible. The company has also created a reimbursement process for affected users and will provide gas fee assistance to cover the costs of fund transfers.</p><p>Users who experienced abnormal fund movement in late December 2022 and late March 2023 may be among those affected by the two exploits. Trust Wallet has urged affected customers to create a new wallet and transfer their funds. Users with vulnerable addresses will be notified through the Trust Wallet browser extension.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/cryptocurrencies\">TokenInsight</a> is dedicated to covering the most important and cutting-edge trends in the world of crypto.             "title": "RWA Sector Grows Fast with Market Cap Increases 60% in 2023, TokenInsight Report Shows",
            "content": "<p>TokenInsight publishes the Crypto Market Insights 2023 Q3 report, which shows that real-world asset (RWA) is one of the hottest sectors in crypto now. As of September, the market cap of RWA sector has grown by approximately 60% compared with the beginning of the year.</p><p><img src=\"https://s2.tokeninsight.com/static/calendar/img202309290224260b3d9951-b0b7-40a6-9dae-ff5f6ef44a44.jpg\"></p><p>Lending is currently one of the best-performing areas in the RWA space, providing new financing methods for small and medium-sized enterprises and offering higher returns for DeFi users. As of September 24, 2023, a total of 1,748 loans were issued in the market, valued at $4.4 billion. The outstanding loan value stood at $555.8 million, an increase of 77% since the beginning of the year. The average interest rate for these loans was 9.94%, generally higher than the yield of non-RWA lending.</p><p>Tokenized US treasury bonds also become a popular investment option. Since 2023, the market cap of tokenized treasury bonds has risen by 452%, reaching $629.5 million. Currently, the average yield for on-chain tokenized treasury bonds stands at 5.25%, while the yield for stablecoin lending on Aave V2 (Ethereum) ranges from 3.5% to 4.5%.</p><p><img src=\"https://s2.tokeninsight.com/static/calendar/img202309290224264afaba8f-9f25-46c9-8c91-1f113febe15b.jpg\"></p><p><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/coins/makerdao/overview\">Maker</a> is among the projects that benefit from RWA the most. As of now, the value of RWA vaults on Maker is approximately $3 billion, accounting for 55% of the total protocol assets. Since increasing its holdings in RWA, Maker's revenue has significantly improved, rising by 624% in the past year. RWA currently contributes 64% to the protocol's earnings.</p><p>To learn more, please read the full report: <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/research/reports/crypto-market-insights-2023-q3\">Crypto Market Insights 2023 Q3</a></p><p><img src=\"https://s2.tokeninsight.com/static/calendar/img202309290224379f639a44-5463-4430-8ed2-b8271254cf2d.jpg\"></p><p>Stay updated with the most important <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/news\">cryptocurrency news</a> and valuable insights, conveniently delivered to your email every day. <a rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\" target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://mailchi.mp/tokeninsight/newsletter\">Subscribe to the TokenInsight mailing list now!</a></p><p>Prefer social media?             "content": "<p><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/coins/makerdao/overview\">MakerDAO</a> founder Rune Christensen has published an article in the community titled \"Explore a fork of the <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/coins/solana/overview\">Solana</a> codebase for NewChain\" which states that the fifth and final stage of the Endgame is to rebuild the MakerDAO protocol on a new independent blockchain called NewChain.</p><p>This upcoming new native chain for MakerDAO is intended to be built off of a fork of Solana's codebase, not the Ethereum Virtual Machine, despite the protocol's has been runing on Ethereum since its launch.</p><p>The final phase is expected to take at lease 3 years or even longer to complete, and it wil be a full re-implementation of the Maker Protocol on a new stand-alone blockchain.</p><p>In the proposal, Rune described Solana's codebase as the \"Most promising\" option to explore and offered three key reasons, including Solana codebase's technical quality, the resilience shown after gone through the FTX blowup and several other challenges, and finally existing examples of the Solaba codebase being forked and adapted to develop NewChain.</p><p>The primary reason for NewChain is its ability to allow the ecosystem to recover from the most severe governance attacks or technical failures through a hard fork. It also enables the system to address technical debt in the protocol that extends up to 8 years and implies that all components of the protocol can be purposefully reconstructed based on their exact role in the final, permanent Endgame technical design.</p><p><img src=\"https://s2.tokeninsight.com/static/calendar/img202309020236038ea696f1-2ae0-4739-9423-c720a2cb4f2e.jpg\"></p><p>Stay updated with the most important <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/news\">cryptocurrency news</a> and valuable insights, conveniently delivered to your email every day. <a rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\" target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://mailchi.mp/tokeninsight/newsletter\">Subscribe to the TokenInsight mailing list now!</a></p><p>Prefer social media?             "title": "MakerDAO Founder Initiates Proposal Regarding Spark Pre-Farming Airdrop and SubDAO Farming Model",
            "content": "<p>Rune Christensen, the founder of <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/coins/makerdao/overview\">MakerDAO</a>, has initiated a community proposal regarding the 'SparkDAO SPK pre-farming airdrop; general SubDAO farming overview.' The proposal outlines the potential SPK pre-farming airdrop plan for the lending protocol Spark Protocol and reviews the general SubDAO farming economic model, which is set to launch in the second phase.</p><p>The proposal suggests retroactively calculating which users have borrowed from the Spark Protocol and starting the calculation from the moment when the borrowing interest rate was raised to 5%. Token distribution will be based on the proportion of the volatile assets they have collateralized and the duration of time. Users will be eligible for the airdrop without taking any specific action.</p><p>Over a span of 10 years, a total of 2 billion SubDAO tokens will be distributed to each SubDAO participant. In the first two years, the initial farming rate is 500 million SubDAO tokens annually, with 350 million SubDAO tokens allocated for NewStable yield farmers and 150 million SubDAO tokens allocated for NewGovToken yield farmers each year.</p><p>For the following two years (third to fourth year), the initial farming rate reduces to 250 million SubDAO tokens annually, with 175 million SubDAO tokens allocated for NewStable yield farmers and 75 million SubDAO tokens allocated for NewGovToken yield farmers each year.</p><p>MakerDAO's End Game plan involves breaking down the existing DAO structure into smaller autonomous entities called SubDAOs. These entities are autonomous and self-sustaining, each having their own tokens within the MakerDAO ecosystem.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/cryptocurrencies\">TokenInsight</a> is dedicated to covering the most important and cutting-edge trends in the world of crypto.             "content": "<p><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/coins/cosmosatom/overview\">Cosmos</a>-based Layer1 blockchain <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/coins/injective-protocol/overview\">Injective</a> announced the launch of inEVM, a EVM-compatible Layer2 rollup solution capable of achieving composability across Cosmos and Solana co-developed with Caldera, a Layer2 rollup infrastructure platform. inEVM is now live on the testnet.</p><p>With inEVM, <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/coins/ethereum/overview\">Ethereum</a> developers will be able to deploy in the Injective ecosystem. Dapps on inEVM can compose directly with Cosmos and Solana applications, achiving inter and intra VM interoperability. The integration will use IBC Protocol as the communication layer to facilitate cross-chain messages, enabling users to exchange assets between the two blockchains  directly, eliminating the need for lock-and-mint bridge mechanisms.</p><p>The integration is currently live on the Injective testnet, enabling a seamless mesh liquidity network.</p><p><img src=\"https://s2.tokeninsight.com/static/calendar/img202308251153570570f301-208f-4265-9cdb-c3382628b565.jpg\"></p><ul><li>Stay updated with the most important <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/news\">cryptocurrency news</a> and valuable insights, conveniently delivered to your email every day. <a rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\" target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://mailchi.mp/tokeninsight/newsletter\">Subscribe to the TokenInsight mailing list now!</a></li><li>Prefer social media?             "content": "<p>The decentralized indexing protocol, <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/coins/the-graph/overview\">The Graph</a>, has proposed GIP-0052, suggesting that the current 5% indexing reward on Layer 2 be gradually increased to 100%.</p><p>A timetable and implementation process have been put forward: from 5% to 25% (expected to be reached during the week of May 8, 2023), then to 50% (expected to be reached during the week of May 22), 95% (expected to be reached during the week of July 24), and finally to 100% (expected to be reached during the week of August 28).</p><p>The Graph is expanding to Ethereum Layer 2 to enable faster transactions, significantly reduce gas costs, and participate more openly in the network. Moving the indexing rewards from Ethereum to Arbitrum will allow more indexers to operate on Layer 2, while also providing more rewards for curators and delegators.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/cryptocurrencies\">TokenInsight</a> is dedicated to covering the most important and cutting-edge trends in the world of crypto.             "timestamp": 1676603767000,
            "title": "The Graph Network now supports Arbitrum",
            "content": "<p><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/coins/the-graph/overview\">The Graph</a>, a decentralized data indexing and query platform, is planning to scale onto <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/coins/arbitrum/overview\">Arbitrum</a>. The transition will occur in three phases, with the first phase already completed.</p><p>During this initial deployment, the protocol will co-exist on L1 and L2, but the $GRT token smart contract will remain on L1, and $GRT will only be available on Arbitrum through the GRT bridge. Indexing rewards are disabled in this phase.</p><p>Phase 2 will see the deployment of GIP-0037, which will enable indexing rewards on Arbitrum, officially marking the end of the experimental phase. This phase will be followed by phase 3, which will see indexing rewards gradually diverted to L2 as network usage increases on Arbitrum. Additionally, curators will migrate their curation signal to Arbitrum, which will include a flattened bonding curve, while curation on Ethereum will remain unchanged.</p><p>The migration process will include migration helpers and 1-click migration for all network participants to easily move from Ethereum to Arbitrum. Core developers will work closely with community participants to ensure a smooth protocol migration experience.</p>",

            "content": "<p>Reported by The Defiant, Rocket Pool's rETH is dominating trading volume among liquid staking tokens. Data from IntoTheBlock shows rETH accounting for more than half of the liquid staking sector's volume over the past three weeks. The token drove $28.8M worth of trades compared to stETH's $6.7M.</p><p>The data also shows increasing activity surrounding Frax's FrxETH and sFraxETH.</p><p><img src=\"https://s2.tokeninsight.com/static/calendar/img20231120113546e483ebd0-e2df-4c5a-8501-b94d93c4f7db.jpg\"></p><p>The surge in rETH activity could be attributed to the launch of Prisma Finance's LST-backed stablecoin, mkUSD, alongside adoption incentives in the form of its native PRISMA token, according to research by IntoTheBlock.</p><p>“We looked into it on-chain, and it appears that the spike in rETH volumes the past few weeks is linked to the launch of PRISMA,” said Lucas Outumuro, Head of Research at IntoTheBlock. “They increased the supply caps on Nov. 2 and launched their token as incentives for people to mint mkUSD through the protocol.</p><p>\"This appears to have increased demand for rETH, with deposits into Prisma spiking that day.”</p><p>Outumouro added that the jump in rETH demand from Prisma users drove up the token’s price, opening up arbitrage strategies for opportunistic traders.</p><p>“There was a lot of volume since rETH was bought on the market, driving its price to a premium relative to its ETH holdings, and then more volume to arbitrage the price back down,” he said.</p>",

            "content": "<p>Stablecoin protocol Prisma Finance announced its successful deployment on the <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/coins/ethereum/overview\">Ethereum</a> mainnet. The protocol will be accessible to users today at 9 am UTC.</p><p>Prisma Finance allows users to use $ETH liquid staking tokens (LST) as collateral to mint the protocol's stablecoin, $mkUSD, and supports $wstETH, $rETH, $sfrxETH, and $cbETH as collateral. The protocol is undergoing a Guarded Launch and initially, there's a debt cap for each collateral. The total amount of $mkUSD mintable for each collateral is $6 million for $wstETH, $rETH, and $sfrxETH, and $2 million for $cbETH.</p><p>After the Guarded Launch, Prisma Finance will launch its token $PRISMA, which can be locked by users to receive $vePRISMA, allowing them to participate in governance and boost their $PRISMA emissions.</p><p>Related: <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/news/stablecoin-protocol-prisma-finance-raises-funds-from-curve-founder-okx-ventures-and-others\">Stablecoin Protocol Prisma Finance Raises Funds from Curve Founder, OKX Ventures and Others</a></p><p><img src=\"https://s2.tokeninsight.com/static/calendar/img20230901024741110e5edf-b5bd-4557-bc27-dd9cfed69935.jpg\"></p><ul><li>Stay updated with the most important <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/news\">cryptocurrency news</a> and valuable insights, conveniently delivered to your email every day. <a rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\" target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://mailchi.mp/tokeninsight/newsletter\">Subscribe to the TokenInsight mailing list now!</a></li><li>Prefer social media?             "timestamp": 1678422922000,
            "title": "New York Attorney General Says $ETH Is Security in Lawsuit Against KuCoin",
            "content": "<p>New York State Attorney General Letitia James filed a lawsuit against <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/exchanges/kucoin\">KuCoin</a> on Thursday, alleging the crypto exchange is an unregistered commodity and securities broker and dealer that offers securities without registering with the Office of the Attorney General (OAG), including cryptocurrencies like <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/coins/ethereum/overview\">$ETH</a>, <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/coins/terra-luna/overview\">$LUNA</a> and<a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/coins/terrausd/overview\"> $UST</a>, and KuCoin's saving and staking product KuCoin Earn.</p><p>In the lawsuit file, James said that these tokens are securities under the Martin Act,</p><blockquote><p>\"The Tokens were promoted as profit opportunities that were contingent on the growth of their respective networks, $ETH, $LUNA, and $UST. The growth and development of these networks were dependent on the managerial efforts of the founders and management teams of these tokens and were reasonably believed to lead investors to a profit from their entrepreneurial and managerial efforts. Additionally, sums of the tokens' distribution were reserved for their founders and management teams, thereby appearing to tie the fortunes of the token holder to the management teams, creating a common enterprise. Accordingly, the Tokens were securities.\"</p></blockquote><p>James asked the court to order KuCoin to stop operation in New York, and to block New York-based IP addresses from accessing KuCoin's app, website and services.</p><p>According to CoinDesk, this is the first time a regulator has claimed in court that $ETH is a security. On the definition of $ETH, the US Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) and the Commodity Futures Trading Commission (CFTC) <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/news/cftc-vs-sec-are-stablecoins-and-ether-commodities-or-securities\">have different opinions</a>. Previously, SEC Chair Gary Gensler said he viewed all digital assets except for Bitcoin as securities, while CFTC Chair Rostin Behnam claimed $ETH was a commodity. James' lawsuit file, however, said that $ETH falls within the Martin Act's definition of both commodities and securities.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/cryptocurrencies\">TokenInsight</a> is dedicated to covering the most valuable news in the world of crypto. If you have information to share with us, please feel free to contact our email <a href=\"mailto:news@tokeninsight.com\">news@tokeninsight.com</a>. Your trust will be well respected.</p>",

            "timestamp": 1705980271000,
            "title": "8% Ethereum Validators Went Down on Sunday, Sparking Worries on Client Diversity",
            "content": "<p>Reported by Coindesk, a bug in Ethereum's Nethermind client software – used by validators of the blockchain to interact with the network – knocked out a chunk of the chain's key operators on Sunday.</p><p>It was a manageable incident, but the episode revived a long-simmering debate in the Ethereum ecosystem around the need for \"client diversity.\" Some experts took the opportunity to point out how bad things could have been if another client software, Geth, the chain's most popular execution client, had gone out; the question is whether Ethereum could have kept going since Geth stands out as a possible single point of failure for the network.</p><p>Nethermind powers around 8% of the validators that operate Ethereum, and this weekend's bug was critical enough to pull those validators offline. Ethereum stayed up and running despite the issue, and Nethermind's developers released a patch fixing things within hours. The main consequence of the bug was that modest financial penalties fell onto some Nethermind-based validators.</p><p>Around 85% of Ethereum's validators are currently powered by Geth, and the recent outages to smaller execution clients have renewed concerns that Geth's dominant market position could pose grave consequences if there were ever issues with its programming.</p><p>Depending on the nature of the bug, a Geth glitch could halt the entire network, rendering it impossible for validators to add new blocks to the blockchain. Ethereum is also programmed to penalize validators that fall offline or break the network's rules, meaning thousands of Geth-based validators could be held financially liable in the event of a bug, and the penalties could get even bigger if the bug proves difficult to patch.</p>",

            "content": "<p>Hedera network has approved to allocate 4.86 billion Hedera token HBAR from Hedera Treasury for further development and advanced decentralized governance.</p><p>The Hedera Global Council, the entity overseeing the Hedera network, said in the blog post that the majority of the fund will be directed toward existing initiatives, including the HBAR Foundation, the Hashgraph Association and the DLT Science Foundation.</p><p>In addition to supporting ecosystem growth, 614.06 million HBAR will be used for the council’s operational costs and to compensate early simple agreements for future token buyers.</p><p>“2023 saw the accelerated adoption of the Hedera network with more than 33 billion real world transactions on the network, and the ecosystem partners played a key role helping applications to go to market and onboard new users,” said Betsabe Botaitis, CFO of the Hedera Council. “With this foundation solidly in place, the Hedera Council is pleased to further support the development and utilization of the network with these new grants.”</p>",

            "timestamp": 1678437634000,
            "title": "Hedera Confirms Smart Contract Attack on Mainnet, Some LP Token Stolen",
            "content": "<p><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/coins/hedera-hashgraphhbar/overview\">Hedera</a> Hashgraph has confirmed the occurrence of a smart contract exploit on the Hedera Mainnet that resulted in the theft of several liquidity pool tokens.</p><p>According to Hedera, the attacker targeted liquidity pool tokens on decentralized exchanges (DEXs) that derived its code from Uniswap v2 on Ethereum, which was ported over for use on the Hedera Token Service. Hedera also reported that the suspicious activity was detected when the attacker tried to move the stolen tokens across the Hashport bridge, which included liquidity pool tokens on <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/coins/saucerswap/overview\">SaucerSwap</a>, <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/coins/pangolin/overview\">Pangolin</a>, and <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/coins/heliswap/overview\">HeliSwap</a>.</p><p>The operators acted promptly and temporarily paused the bridge to prevent the movement of stolen tokens. The team at Hedera did not confirm the amount of tokens that were stolen.</p><p>Hedera managed to shut down network access by turning off IP proxies on March 9 and stated that it has identified the root cause of the exploit and is working on a solution. Once the solution is ready, Hedera Council members will sign transactions to approve the deployment of updated code on the mainnet to remove the vulnerability. The team added that once the mainnet proxies are turned back on, normal activity will resume.</p><p><img src=\"https://s2.tokeninsight.com/static/calendar/img20230310043557d511017d-d1e9-44f9-9d9f-cac52fedb582.jpg\"></p><p>&nbsp;</p><p><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/cryptocurrencies\">TokenInsight</a> is dedicated to covering the most valuable news in the world of crypto.             "content": "<p><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/coins/hedera-hashgraphhbar/overview\">Hedera</a>, a distributed public ledger infrastructure, has shut down network services after revealing it has been experiencing “network irregularities.” The platform <a rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\" target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://twitter.com/hedera/status/1633925272830623746?s=20\">tweeted</a> that it was turning off network proxies on mainnet, making it inaccessible in an abundance of caution and safety for users.</p><p>The report of irregular activity has fueled speculation on social media platforms that hackers have attacked the platform, but Hedera has neither confirmed nor denied those rumors.</p><blockquote><p>“The exploit is targeting the decompiling process in smart contracts,\" tweeted DeFi researcher <a rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\" target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://twitter.com/DefiIgnas/status/1633821155231674375?s=20\">Ignas</a>. “Advice: Get your funds out now.\"</p></blockquote><p>The price of Hedera’s native token, $HBAR, has fallen 6% to roughly 5.6 cents since the network’s first public acknowledgement of the issues earlier Thursday. Hedera has said it will re-enable network proxies when the issue is resolved.</p><p>The cause of the irregularities had not been ascertained.             "title": "Celo Proposes Transition to Ethereum Layer2 Network Based on OP Stack",
            "content": "<p>cLabs, the company behind Layer1 blockchain <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/coins/celocelo/overview\">Celo</a>, proposed a major upgrade for Celo to migrate it from an EVM compatible Layer1 to an <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/coins/ethereum/overview\">Ethereum</a> Layer2 based on OP Stack. The upgrade aimed to further Celo's EVM compatibility, enhance its security, and bring more real-world use cases to Ethereum.</p><p>According to cLabs, the proposed Layer2 will use an off-chain data availability layer powered by EigenLayer, operated by Ethereum node operators, and protected by restaked $ETH. Celo's existing validator set will power the decentralized sequencer. Celo's 1-block finality will be retained, and the gas fees will be maintained at a low level. cLabs said that the gas cost of the new Celo will be lower than other Layer2 networks like Optimism and zkSync Era.</p><p>The upgrade will not affect end users and the $CELO token. $CELO will still be used for governance and gas payment. cLabs will release an indicative on-chain governance proposal on July 22 for the community to vote.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/cryptocurrencies\">TokenInsight</a> is dedicated to covering the most important and cutting-edge trends in the world of crypto.             "timestamp": 1687336418000,
            "title": "SubWallet Releases Polkadot Staking Report H1 2023",
            "content": "<p><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/coins/polkadot/overview\">Polkadot</a>-based wallet SubWallet and research and data platform Dotinsights announced the release of Polkadot Staking Report H1 2023, which is the first comprehensive staking report for the Polkadot ecosystem, with in-depth analyses on overall state of staking, validators, nominators and nomination pools.</p><p>Polkadot develops a variant of Proof-of-Stake called Nominated Proof-of-Stake, in which stakeholders get to select which validators to support with tokens. Nominators receive staking rewards when their chosen validators act honestly, but have their collateral slashed when the validators exhibit malicious behaviors. In November 2022, Polkadot introduced nomination pools to lower the staking entry barrier. Nomination pools allow token holders to stake as low as 1 $DOT and to entrust nomination management to the pool operators. There are currently four ways to stake $DOT natively: running a validator, nominating directly, opening a nomination pool, and joining a nomination pool.</p><figure class=\"image\"><img src=\"https://s2.tokeninsight.com/static/news/content/img/dot.png\"></figure><p>According to the report, the $DOT total supply increased steadily from 1.25B on November 1, 2022 to 1.32B on May 31, 2023, while the total stake amount dropped from 638.13M (51.13% staking ratio) to 569.13M (43.14% staking ratio). Overall, the $DOT price correlated moderately with the staking ratio.</p><p>From November 2022 to May 2023, the amount of validators remained relatively stable between 917 and 990, while the total nominator count surged in November 2022 and reached a peak of 47,672 on December 5, 2022. Most of the nominator rewards stayed in the range of 87.78K to 178.50K $DOT.</p><p>At the beginning of May, the Polkadot nomination pools surpassed 10K in total members and 4M $DOT in total stake. Daily pool rewards rose rapidly from 3.22 $DOT on November 2, 2022 to a maximum of 2.83K $DOT on May 22, 2023.</p><p>For more information, please read <a rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\" target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://dotinsights.subwallet.app/polkadot-staking-report-h1-2023-en/\">Polkadot Staking Report H1 2023</a>.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/cryptocurrencies\">TokenInsight</a> is dedicated to covering the most important and cutting-edge trends in the world of crypto.             "title": "Lido on Polkadot and Kusama to Sunset on August 1st",
            "content": "<p>Liquid staking protocol <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/coins/lido-dao-token/overview\">Lido</a> announced it has reached a mutual agreement with MixBytes, its partner in the <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/coins/polkadot/overview\">Polkadot</a> ecosystem, that development and operation support for Lido on Polkadot and <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/coins/kusama/overview\">Kusama</a> will be discontinued on August 1st, 2023.</p><p>According to MixBytes, Lido on Polkadot and Kusama faced some key challenges that led to unmet financial expectations, including,</p><ul><li>The protocol's data related to adoption and growth did not meet business case expectations;</li><li>The lack of liquidity in the Polkadot's DeFi ecosystem due to challenged macro economic factors;</li><li>Lido's priorities leaning towards <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/coins/ethereum/overview\">Ethereum</a>.</li></ul><p>Lido on Polkadot and Kusama had stopped accepting new staking deposits on March 15th. Existing <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/coins/lido-staked-polkadot/overview\">$stDOT</a> and <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/coins/lido-on-kusama/overview\">$stKSM </a>holders will continue to receive rewards until June 15th, when redemptions will also be halted. The assets will automatically be unstaked from the relay chain on June 22nd, and be relocated to parachains. Users can claim the assets only via UI for protocol. On August 1st, the protocol will officially sunset.</p><p>Meanwhile, MixBytes said it is evaluating the possibility of technically supporting a dedicated Polkadot and Kusama native liquid staking solution.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/cryptocurrencies\">TokenInsight</a> is dedicated to covering the most important and cutting-edge trends in the world of crypto.             "title": "Helium Network Set to Migrate to Solana on March 27",
            "content": "<p>The <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/coins/helium/overview\">Helium</a> Foundation, a leading provider of decentralized wireless networks, has announced the migration of the Helium Network to the Solana blockchain, set to take place on March 27, 2023.</p><p>The migration is expected to enable the Helium Network to achieve greater scale and become a network of networks. With Solana's capability of processing thousands of transactions per second and an ecosystem of developers, applications, and integrations, the Helium community can focus on building wireless protocols and enabling utility on these networks. The migration to Solana has been enabled by the community passing HIP-70 and introducing several solutions to scaling the Helium network.</p><p>The migration will encompass all wallets, Hotspots, and Helium Network state and will take place over a 24-hour transition period commencing at approximately 1500 UTC / 10:00 AM ET. Hotspot Owners and token holders will not need to take any action to participate in the upgrade.</p><p>The Helium Network is a decentralized wireless Internet of Things (IoT) network. The network consists of nodes that are generally owned and placed by individuals in their homes or offices. They are rewarded for their participation in the network with payments of <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/coins/helium/overview\">$HNT</a>. The Helium Network blockchain is now an independent, open-source, public blockchain that incentivizes the creation of physical, decentralized wireless networks.</p>",

Frax is closely linked with Curve and may be affected by the Curve Crisis.</p><ul><li><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/coins/convex-finance/rating\"><strong>Convex Finance ($CVX)</strong></a>: Downgraded from BB Stable to B Stable.</li></ul><p>The rating downgrade for $CVX is mainly influenced by the secondary market, on-chain, and ecosystem indicators. According to TokenInsight 's analysis, there are sustainability concerns with this project.</p><h3>About TokenInsight and Rating Methodology</h3><p>TokenInsight is an indicators-driven blockchain institution that provides market intelligence through ratings, industry research, and data analysis. Our rating methodology utilizes standardized criteria, combining quantitative and qualitative analysis to ensure objective and consistent evaluations. For a detailed understanding of our methodology, rating symbols, and outlooks, please refer to the <a rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\" target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.gitbook.io/support/methodologies/rating/token-rating\">TokenInsight Token Rating Methodology</a>.</p><p>Notice: TokenInsight's rating methodology is solely for assessing the project and token's qualification and risk within the blockchain industry. It is not intended for evaluating the investment value of tokens. The rating results should not be the basis for making investment decisions.</p><p>Investing in blockchain projects carries inherent risks, and individuals should conduct their own research and seek advice from financial advisors before making any investment.</p><p><img src=\"https://s2.tokeninsight.com/static/calendar/img20230908075513053bede5-3d71-4dac-a129-dc71565b1e94.jpg\"></p><ul><li>Stay updated with the most important <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/news\">cryptocurrency news</a> and valuable insights, conveniently delivered to your email every day. <a rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\" target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://mailchi.mp/tokeninsight/newsletter\">Subscribe to the TokenInsight mailing list now!</a></li><li>Prefer social media?
