          {
            "timestamp": 1706077463000,
            "title": "Uma Protocol Introduced Oval Allows DeFi Protocols to Capture Oracle Extractable Value",
            "content": "<p>Reported by The Block, blockchain project Uma has rolled out a solution called Oval, which aims to allow DeFi protocols to capture value that emerges during oracle updates by tapping into what’s known as oracle extractable value — a type of MEV generated when protocols request price updates from an oracle.</p><p>MEV involves extracting value by manipulating transaction order in a block on the Ethereum network, often with the aid of automated bots. This type of MEV arises either from the lack of liquidity across different decentralized exchanges or from their front-running each other under certain market conditions.</p><p>There is one type of MEV related to oracles, as Uma notes. In the decentralized finance niche — and in protocols such as lending or borrowing — oracles are crucial as they provide external data, like price feeds, to smart contracts. When an oracle update occurs, such as a price feed update, it can create MEV opportunities. For instance, if a lending protocol relies on an oracle for the latest asset prices, there may be a brief window post-update where a trader can leverage this information before the market responds.</p><p>“MEV is a major issue for Ethereum, with tens of millions of dollars extracted every year. OEV accounts for a big chunk of that because protocols need price updates,” Uma co-founder Hart Lambur said. “Oval addresses a real problem by helping protocols capture OEV. It’s been a privilege to work with Flashbots’ best-in-class team to bring Oval to mainnet.”</p><p>Oval's goal is to enable protocols, such as lending, to utilize this solution to retain and profit from this value rather than losing it to bots. In this setup, MEV searchers participate in an auction system, bidding for the right to access data from Chainlink oracles related to a certain protocol. The auction proceeds then benefit the protocol.</p>",
            "image_url": "https://s2.tokeninsight.com/static/news/cover/img/oval.png",

          },
          {
            "timestamp": 1695218038000,
            "title": "One Mining Pool Controls 53% of Zcash's Hash Power, Prompting Double Spending Risk",
            "content": "<p>Mining Pool ViaBTC currently wields a substantial 53.8% of the <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/coins/zcash/overview\">Zcash</a> network's total hash rate, as reported by MiningPoolStats. This situation raises concerns, as it theoretically enables the mining pool to engage in malicious activities such as double spending attacks.</p><p>In response to this potential threat, exchanges like Coinbase have implemented precautionary measures. They now require 110 block confirmations before confirming ZEC deposits, resulting in a deposit time of approximately 2.5 hours. The primary objective behind this move is to mitigate the risk of double spending. Double-spending is the risk that a cryptocurrency can be used twice or more. This threat emerges when a single entity controls over 51% of the hash rate in a proof-of-work blockchain.</p><p>It's important to note that this dominance doesn't stem from a single miner but rather from a mining pool. Mining pools are collections of numerous miners who combine their computational resources to achieve a more consistent income. In the event that the mining pool engages in harmful activities, individual miners have the option to discontinue their association with the pool and seek alternatives.</p><p><img src=\"https://s2.tokeninsight.com/static/calendar/img20230920095354c957461a-da41-430b-be66-851268c66483.jpg\"></p><p>Stay updated with the most important <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/news\">cryptocurrency news</a> and valuable insights, conveniently delivered to your email every day. <a rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\" target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://mailchi.mp/tokeninsight/newsletter\">Subscribe to the TokenInsight mailing list now!</a></p><p>Prefer social media?           {
            "timestamp": 1706077463000,
            "title": "Uma Protocol Introduced Oval Allows DeFi Protocols to Capture Oracle Extractable Value",
            "content": "<p>Reported by The Block, blockchain project Uma has rolled out a solution called Oval, which aims to allow DeFi protocols to capture value that emerges during oracle updates by tapping into what’s known as oracle extractable value — a type of MEV generated when protocols request price updates from an oracle.</p><p>MEV involves extracting value by manipulating transaction order in a block on the Ethereum network, often with the aid of automated bots. This type of MEV arises either from the lack of liquidity across different decentralized exchanges or from their front-running each other under certain market conditions.</p><p>There is one type of MEV related to oracles, as Uma notes. In the decentralized finance niche — and in protocols such as lending or borrowing — oracles are crucial as they provide external data, like price feeds, to smart contracts. When an oracle update occurs, such as a price feed update, it can create MEV opportunities. For instance, if a lending protocol relies on an oracle for the latest asset prices, there may be a brief window post-update where a trader can leverage this information before the market responds.</p><p>“MEV is a major issue for Ethereum, with tens of millions of dollars extracted every year. OEV accounts for a big chunk of that because protocols need price updates,” Uma co-founder Hart Lambur said. “Oval addresses a real problem by helping protocols capture OEV. It’s been a privilege to work with Flashbots’ best-in-class team to bring Oval to mainnet.”</p><p>Oval's goal is to enable protocols, such as lending, to utilize this solution to retain and profit from this value rather than losing it to bots. In this setup, MEV searchers participate in an auction system, bidding for the right to access data from Chainlink oracles related to a certain protocol. The auction proceeds then benefit the protocol.</p>",
            "image_url": "https://s2.tokeninsight.com/static/news/cover/img/oval.png",

This will be the first time the unlocking will be in front of teams and investors.</p><figure class=\"image\"><img src=\"https://s2.tokeninsight.com/static/calendar/img20230914044904400e0d56-16db-4cbb-8a4e-bb4763cd2b27.jpg\"></figure><p>The number of $APT tokens unlocked in November equaled 112% of the average daily trading volume over the past 30 days, research firm The Tie said. The firm said earlier this year that unlocks that free up liquidity, or those that represent over 100% of the average daily volume, tend to weigh over prices.</p><p>These unlocks will occur on a monthly basis and will coincide with the monthly staking reward unlocks (5.83 million $APT or 32% of daily average volume, which will increase to 6.15 million $APT in December). In addition, 4.62 million $APT has been unlocked to communities and foundations each month since last year,\" The Tie said.</p><p><img src=\"https://s2.tokeninsight.com/static/calendar/img20230914045013615b50f7-dde2-4a62-887b-5dbbc98c377b.jpg\"></p><p>Stay updated with the most important <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/news\">cryptocurrency news</a> and valuable insights, conveniently delivered to your email every day. <a rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\" target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://mailchi.mp/tokeninsight/newsletter\">Subscribe to the TokenInsight mailing list now!</a></p><p>Prefer social media?             "timestamp": 1684837350000,
            "title": "Decentralized Exchange WOO X Shares Live Balance Sheet in Response to Insolvency Claim",
            "content": "<p>Investigation journalist Chris Brunet released a report on Substack, claiming that decentralized exchange <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/coins/woo-network/overview\">WOO X</a> is seriously insolvent, advising users to withdraw funds from the platform. In response, WOO X said on Twitter, \"so a foreign language media misreported a story about WOO X being insolvent. Needless to say, we are not. Transparency has always been our core value and unfortunately that makes us a target for elaborate but false assumptions.\" In addition, the DEX posted the link of its Live Balance Sheet in the comment section.</p><p>In his report, Chris Brunet said that, similar to FTX having Alameda Research, WOO X has a dubious hedge fund called Kronos Research. \"Although I lack concrete evidence, I suspect that Kronos may be employing WOO X's deposits for speculative purposes.\" he said.</p><p>In addition, Chris Brunet said that WOO X's custody ratio shown on its website is lower than 80%. \"Even in the most optimistic scenario of a bank run, WOO X can only cover approximately 80% of deposited funds.\" Meanwhile, according to Nansen's data, over 76% of WOO X's reserve is in its own token $WOO.</p><p>However, according to WOO X website, the current reserve ratio of the platform is 127.7%, while the custody ratio is 80.8%. Regarding the fact that the custody ratio is below 100%, there has been an explanation on WOO X's website. \"The custody ratio shows what percent of user deposit liabilities are stored with custodians or in cold storage, versus stored in third-party liquidity sources. Currently, some shares of users' deposits are utilized for hedging and liquidity aggregation on third-party platforms to provide the best price execution for traders on WOO X.\"</p><figure class=\"image\"><img src=\"https://s2.tokeninsight.com/static/news/content/img/369.png\"></figure><p>\"Funds on exchanges are used solely for hedging and liquidity aggregation purposes, and are never used for speculation. The custody ratio reports the amount of user deposit liabilities safeguarded in custody and insulated from counterparty risk with third-party exchanges and market makers. Moreover, WOO Network monitors third-party credit-worthiness 24/7/365 to minimize counterparty risk. Assets exposed on liquidity sources can be recalled to custody if counterparty risk is deemed too high.\"</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/cryptocurrencies\">TokenInsight</a> is dedicated to covering the most important and cutting-edge trends in the world of crypto.           {
            "timestamp": 1706077463000,
            "title": "Uma Protocol Introduced Oval Allows DeFi Protocols to Capture Oracle Extractable Value",
            "content": "<p>Reported by The Block, blockchain project Uma has rolled out a solution called Oval, which aims to allow DeFi protocols to capture value that emerges during oracle updates by tapping into what’s known as oracle extractable value — a type of MEV generated when protocols request price updates from an oracle.</p><p>MEV involves extracting value by manipulating transaction order in a block on the Ethereum network, often with the aid of automated bots. This type of MEV arises either from the lack of liquidity across different decentralized exchanges or from their front-running each other under certain market conditions.</p><p>There is one type of MEV related to oracles, as Uma notes. In the decentralized finance niche — and in protocols such as lending or borrowing — oracles are crucial as they provide external data, like price feeds, to smart contracts. When an oracle update occurs, such as a price feed update, it can create MEV opportunities. For instance, if a lending protocol relies on an oracle for the latest asset prices, there may be a brief window post-update where a trader can leverage this information before the market responds.</p><p>“MEV is a major issue for Ethereum, with tens of millions of dollars extracted every year. OEV accounts for a big chunk of that because protocols need price updates,” Uma co-founder Hart Lambur said. “Oval addresses a real problem by helping protocols capture OEV. It’s been a privilege to work with Flashbots’ best-in-class team to bring Oval to mainnet.”</p><p>Oval's goal is to enable protocols, such as lending, to utilize this solution to retain and profit from this value rather than losing it to bots. In this setup, MEV searchers participate in an auction system, bidding for the right to access data from Chainlink oracles related to a certain protocol. The auction proceeds then benefit the protocol.</p>",
            "image_url": "https://s2.tokeninsight.com/static/news/cover/img/oval.png",

            "title": "THORChain Launches Lending Feature with No Interest and No Liquidation ",
            "content": "<p><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/coins/thorchain/overview\">THORChain</a> announced the launch of its lending feature, which has no liquidations, no interest, and no expiration. Users can access the lending service via THORSwap or Lends.</p><p>THORChain's lending feature supports using <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/coins/bitcoin/overview\">$BTC</a> or <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/coins/ethereum/overview\">$ETH </a>as collateral now, and will be open to all Layer1 gas assets supported on THORChain. The collateralization ratio is between 200% to 500%. Debt is denominated in $TOR, a USD stablecoin that can't be held or traded and can only be used as the pricing instrument for debt in the lending feature. Loans have a minimum period of 30 days. Borrowers can repay their debt any time after 30 days and receive their collateral back. Partial repayments are possible, but the collateral is not released until the debt is fully repaid. Any THORChain-supported asset can be used to repay the debt.</p><p>The lending feature has a loan cap of 500 million $RUNE. According to THORChain, the feature may have bugs, issues, and vulnerabilities that may require chain pauses, halts, or fixes. Node operators and devs will stay alert in the coming weeks.</p><p><img src=\"https://s2.tokeninsight.com/static/calendar/img20230821042528ad69f6c4-77df-422d-ba50-cd38c5ac2cc4.jpg\"></p><ul><li>Stay updated with the most important <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/news\">cryptocurrency news</a> and valuable insights, conveniently delivered to your email every day. <a rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\" target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://mailchi.mp/tokeninsight/newsletter\">Subscribe to the TokenInsight mailing list now!</a></li><li>Prefer social media?             "title": "EOS to Revive the Blockchain with EVM compatibility",
            "content": "<p><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/coins/eos/overview\">EOS</a>, a blockchain that raised $4 billion in its initial coin offering (ICO) with little to show in its early years, is gearing up for a comeback.</p><p>EOS Network Foundation, led by CEO Yves La Rose, is planning a consensus mechanism upgrade, an Ethereum Virtual Machine (EVM) solution, and a renewed growth strategy. The EVM mainnet is scheduled for release on April 14, with updates and improvements planned in the coming weeks and months.</p><blockquote><p>“Combining the performance of EOS with the familiarity of Ethereum, Solidity developers are in for a treat. At 800+ swaps per second, $EOS EVM will be BY FAR the fastest EVM, benchmarked 3x faster than Solana + BNB and 25x faster than Avax” La Rose <a rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\" target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://twitter.com/BigBeardSamurai/status/1630923966914211842?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw%7Ctwcamp%5Etweetembed%7Ctwterm%5E1630923966914211842%7Ctwgr%5E62cc048aaede6c07e5fc0b798d46f1220f3ec077%7Ctwcon%5Es1_&amp;ref_url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.coindesk.com%2Ftech%2F2023%2F03%2F06%2Feos-blockchain-plans-second-innings-ahead-of-aprils-evm-launch%2F\">Tweeted</a></p></blockquote><p>EVMs are the environment in which all Ethereum accounts and smart contracts live. By deploying EVMs on other blockchains, developers can build dApps and DeFi applications similar to those built on Ethereum. This is a large part of EOS’s future plans. The foundation says that “EVM compatibility is essential to the potential of EOS, not just technically but also from a business perspective. Ultimately, it is essential that we welcome more Solidity developers and users to EOS, and an EVM on EOS is an excellent bridge to do just that.”</p><p>The foundation has also launched a grants program to fund developers working on such applications. Grants will range from $10,000 to over $50,000, based on criteria such as the size and scope of the initiative. They can be provided to builders of wholly-new products or to fund maintenance and upgrades of existing tools.</p>",

            "title": "Conflux Network Revealed more Details about its Blockchain-Enabled SIM Card",
            "content": "<p><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/coins/conflux/overview\">Conflux Network</a>, the regulatory-compliant blockchain in China, has revealed more details about its blockchain-enabled SIM (BSIM) card in a recent interview with Coindesk.</p><p>Coinflux has partnered with China Telecom, the second-largest wireless carrier in China, to launch the first BSIM pilot program in Hong Kong later this year, followed by pilots in key mainland China locations such as Shanghai.</p><p>The BSIM card will manage and store the user's public and private keys in the card and carry out digital signatures in a way that the private key does not exit the card. The BSIM card will allow users to store digital assets safely, transfer digital assets conveniently, and display their assets in a variety of applications. Conflux's Chief Technology Officer, Ming Wu, noted that the BSIM card provides hardware cold wallet security and portability convenience simultaneously, making it attractive to both traditional and crypto users.</p><p>While there may be a small disadvantage for some users concerned about their privacy, the BSIM card's compliance with KYC requirements will make it easier to get support from the Chinese government. Conflux is expected to play a leading role in helping Hong Kong and mainland China expand their operations in the Web3 area.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/cryptocurrencies\">TokenInsight</a> is dedicated to covering the most important and cutting-edge trends in the world of crypto.             "title": "Worldcoin Announced Integration with Shopify, Reddit, Telegram, and More",
            "content": "<p>Worldcoin has launched World ID 2.0. The new version is integrated with Shopify, Mercado Libre, Reddit and Telegram, allowing users to prove their humanness on these platform.</p><p>The new app integrations add to existing ones, including Discord, Talent Protocol, and Okta's Auth0. The new version also allows app developer to choose between different levels of authentication, ranging from \"lite\" to \"max\".</p><p>The different levels are intended to provide “more ways for people to use their World ID based on the security needs of the application and to ensure individuals are not sharing more information than they need or want for a given application.” For example, an app that requires high security may require users to have an orb-verified ID. In contrast, applications that are more focused on convenience may only require a “Device Auth” World ID tied to the user’s mobile phone.</p>",

The loans are paid out in $LUSD, a USD pegged stablecoin, and are secured by a stability pool and fellow borrowers as guarantors.</p><p>Liquity is a non-custodial, immutable, and governance-free protocol that provides a more capital efficient and user-friendly way to borrow stablecoins. The key benefits of Liquity include 0% interest rate, minimum collateral ratio of 110%, governance-free, directly redeemable, and fully decentralized.</p><p>$LUSD is the stablecoin used in the protocol while $LQTY is a secondary token that captures fee revenue and incentivizes early adopters.</p>",

          {
            "timestamp": 1706077463000,
            "title": "Uma Protocol Introduced Oval Allows DeFi Protocols to Capture Oracle Extractable Value",
            "content": "<p>Reported by The Block, blockchain project Uma has rolled out a solution called Oval, which aims to allow DeFi protocols to capture value that emerges during oracle updates by tapping into what’s known as oracle extractable value — a type of MEV generated when protocols request price updates from an oracle.</p><p>MEV involves extracting value by manipulating transaction order in a block on the Ethereum network, often with the aid of automated bots. This type of MEV arises either from the lack of liquidity across different decentralized exchanges or from their front-running each other under certain market conditions.</p><p>There is one type of MEV related to oracles, as Uma notes. In the decentralized finance niche — and in protocols such as lending or borrowing — oracles are crucial as they provide external data, like price feeds, to smart contracts. When an oracle update occurs, such as a price feed update, it can create MEV opportunities. For instance, if a lending protocol relies on an oracle for the latest asset prices, there may be a brief window post-update where a trader can leverage this information before the market responds.</p><p>“MEV is a major issue for Ethereum, with tens of millions of dollars extracted every year. OEV accounts for a big chunk of that because protocols need price updates,” Uma co-founder Hart Lambur said. “Oval addresses a real problem by helping protocols capture OEV. It’s been a privilege to work with Flashbots’ best-in-class team to bring Oval to mainnet.”</p><p>Oval's goal is to enable protocols, such as lending, to utilize this solution to retain and profit from this value rather than losing it to bots. In this setup, MEV searchers participate in an auction system, bidding for the right to access data from Chainlink oracles related to a certain protocol. The auction proceeds then benefit the protocol.</p>",
            "image_url": "https://s2.tokeninsight.com/static/news/cover/img/oval.png",
            "url": "https://tokeninsight.com/en/news/uma-protocol-introduced-oval-allows-defi-protocols-to-capture-oracle-extractable-value?utm_source=public&utm_medium=api&utm_campaign="

The new inflation rate of OSMO will be approximately 11% after the reduction.</p><p>Osmosis is the main decentralized exchange of the Cosmos ecosystem, where trading is conducted with native tokens including $ATOM and bridged tokens such as Axelar wrapped BTC, ETH, and USDC stablecoin.             "title": "Osmosis, Axelar and Akash Introduce Mesh Security Model Lets Chains Secure Each Other",
            "content": "<p><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/coins/osmosis/overview\">Osmosis</a> leads the development of a new security model called \"mesh security\" in the Cosmos ecosystem. The project is funded by Osmosis, <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/coins/axelar/overview\">Axelar</a>, <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/coins/akash-networkakt/overview\">Akash</a> Network, and ATOM Accelerator DAO, and aims to consolidate the value of validator stakes from multiple blockchains to increase security against potential breaches or staking takeovers.</p><p>Mesh security allows Cosmos chains to consolidate their token security. This leads to significantly higher economic security than what a single chain can offer. Validators will have the option to re-stake their bonded tokens to their chosen validators on a partnering chain, similar to the Eigen Layer model on Ethereum.</p><blockquote><p>“With the introduction of mesh security, we can approach security bidirectionally, meaning that two chains, like Osmosis and Juno for example, can provide security to each other,” Sunny Aggarwal, co-founder of Osmosis Labs said.</p></blockquote><p>The development will proceed in three phases, with contributions from teams across the Cosmos ecosystem and an expected final launch in Q1 2024.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/cryptocurrencies\">TokenInsight</a> is dedicated to covering the most important and cutting-edge trends in the world of crypto.             "timestamp": 1702431788000,
            "title": "Celestia to Integrate with Polygon as Data Availability Layer",
            "content": "<p>The Celestia network announced it will integrate with Polygon's chain development kit (CDK) early next year. The integration will provide an \"easily-pluggable component\" for Polygon-based networks to use Celestia for data availability.</p><p>After the integration, transaction fees could be reduced more than 100 times after the network stored compressed transaction data on Celestia instead of Ethereum.</p><p>Layer 2 networks developed on Polygon's CDK employ zero-knowledge rollup technology. They aggregate transactions off-chain and finalize in bundles on the mainnet. However, Ethereum lacks a dedicated execution environment for its DA layers. Ethereum nodes must process and store data on-chain indefinitely, resulting to increased fees for Layer 2 solution. Celestia enables rollups and other modular chains to utilize the network as a data availability and consensus layer.</p>",

            "content": "<p>smlXL, a startup focusing on blockchain infrastructure, announced it has raised $13.4 million in a seed funding round led by <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/capitals/a16z-andreessen-horowitz\">a16z</a>, with participation from Grelock and others.</p><p>smlXL aims to make blockchain more transparent, useful, and accessible.             "title": "Huobi and Gala Games to Compensate Victims of pGala Incident",
            "content": "<p><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/exchanges/huobi\">Huobi</a> and <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/coins/gala/overview\">Gala</a> Games have announced that they will compensate victims of the pGALA incident with up to $50 million worth of cryptocurrencies and software licenses.</p><p>Huobi has pledged $25 million in cash and user benefits, including 15 million tether ($USDT) and $10 million in equity compensation. Gala Games will offer its affected users $25 million worth of node licenses.</p><p>Huobi platform is planning to support the conversion of pGALA into a new token, ROCK (Rock Dao), and be the first to launch it after the conversion is complete. ROCK is a Web3 game token initiated by Gala Games in collaboration with Huobi and TRON.</p><p>The pGALA incident involved a bad actor minting $1 billion worth of pGALA, a wrapped version of GALA, and offloading the tokens on decentralized exchanges, causing the price of $GALA to plummet by 94%. The firms will begin compensating victims within the next week. In addition to the compensation, Gala Games has filed a lawsuit seeking $27.7 million in damages and compensation from pNetwork.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/cryptocurrencies\">TokenInsight</a> is dedicated to covering the most important and cutting-edge trends in the world of crypto.           {
            "timestamp": 1695218038000,
            "title": "One Mining Pool Controls 53% of Zcash's Hash Power, Prompting Double Spending Risk",
            "content": "<p>Mining Pool ViaBTC currently wields a substantial 53.8% of the <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/coins/zcash/overview\">Zcash</a> network's total hash rate, as reported by MiningPoolStats. This situation raises concerns, as it theoretically enables the mining pool to engage in malicious activities such as double spending attacks.</p><p>In response to this potential threat, exchanges like Coinbase have implemented precautionary measures. They now require 110 block confirmations before confirming ZEC deposits, resulting in a deposit time of approximately 2.5 hours. The primary objective behind this move is to mitigate the risk of double spending. Double-spending is the risk that a cryptocurrency can be used twice or more. This threat emerges when a single entity controls over 51% of the hash rate in a proof-of-work blockchain.</p><p>It's important to note that this dominance doesn't stem from a single miner but rather from a mining pool. Mining pools are collections of numerous miners who combine their computational resources to achieve a more consistent income. In the event that the mining pool engages in harmful activities, individual miners have the option to discontinue their association with the pool and seek alternatives.</p><p><img src=\"https://s2.tokeninsight.com/static/calendar/img20230920095354c957461a-da41-430b-be66-851268c66483.jpg\"></p><p>Stay updated with the most important <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/news\">cryptocurrency news</a> and valuable insights, conveniently delivered to your email every day. <a rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\" target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://mailchi.mp/tokeninsight/newsletter\">Subscribe to the TokenInsight mailing list now!</a></p><p>Prefer social media?         "related_news": [
          {
            "timestamp": 1706077463000,
            "title": "Uma Protocol Introduced Oval Allows DeFi Protocols to Capture Oracle Extractable Value",
            "content": "<p>Reported by The Block, blockchain project Uma has rolled out a solution called Oval, which aims to allow DeFi protocols to capture value that emerges during oracle updates by tapping into what’s known as oracle extractable value — a type of MEV generated when protocols request price updates from an oracle.</p><p>MEV involves extracting value by manipulating transaction order in a block on the Ethereum network, often with the aid of automated bots. This type of MEV arises either from the lack of liquidity across different decentralized exchanges or from their front-running each other under certain market conditions.</p><p>There is one type of MEV related to oracles, as Uma notes. In the decentralized finance niche — and in protocols such as lending or borrowing — oracles are crucial as they provide external data, like price feeds, to smart contracts. When an oracle update occurs, such as a price feed update, it can create MEV opportunities. For instance, if a lending protocol relies on an oracle for the latest asset prices, there may be a brief window post-update where a trader can leverage this information before the market responds.</p><p>“MEV is a major issue for Ethereum, with tens of millions of dollars extracted every year. OEV accounts for a big chunk of that because protocols need price updates,” Uma co-founder Hart Lambur said. “Oval addresses a real problem by helping protocols capture OEV. It’s been a privilege to work with Flashbots’ best-in-class team to bring Oval to mainnet.”</p><p>Oval's goal is to enable protocols, such as lending, to utilize this solution to retain and profit from this value rather than losing it to bots. In this setup, MEV searchers participate in an auction system, bidding for the right to access data from Chainlink oracles related to a certain protocol. The auction proceeds then benefit the protocol.</p>",
            "image_url": "https://s2.tokeninsight.com/static/news/cover/img/oval.png",
            "url": "https://tokeninsight.com/en/news/uma-protocol-introduced-oval-allows-defi-protocols-to-capture-oracle-extractable-value?utm_source=public&utm_medium=api&utm_campaign="

            "content": "<p>Reported by The Defiant, Frax Finance has unveiled Frax Bonds (FXB), a utility token that converts into 1 FRAX stablecoin trustlessly upon maturity. The launch marks the completion of Frax’s v3 roadmap, deploying all its new features.</p><p>“FXBs are a way to buy future FRAX stablecoins at a particular timestamp for a discount today,” said the team. Their expectation is that bond yields will mirror U.S Treasury rates for similar maturities with the caveat that FXBs “do not guarantee that right, do not confer any legal redeemability assumptions (other than for $FRAX stablecoin tokens).”</p><p>Frax Bonds will be usable across DeFi, including Curve Finance pools, trading pairs that are looking for leverage, and trustless debt repayment.</p><p>The community behind the stablecoin protocol voted in late December to deploy $20M of its collateral to U.S. Treasuries. It will surely be one of the biggest rollup releases of the year,” Kazemian said.</p><p>The new offering will add to Frax’s existing product suite, which comprises FRAX, a fully collateralized algorithmic stablecoin, a lending platform, an automated market maker, an inflation-linked stablecoin, FPI, and the liquid staking token frxETH.</p><p>The decentralized stablecoin-focused decentralized exchange Curve has already proposed to deploy its exchange functionalities on Fraxatal.</p><p>Fraxtal will use rollups technology, which executes transactions off the Ethereum mainnet, batches the data, compresses it, and sends it back to the mainnet. Frax's liquid staking token frxETH will power layer 2 and act as a gas for the chain.</p>",

            "timestamp": 1702365096000,
            "title": "Synthetix Passed Governance Proposal to End $SNX Token Inflation",
            "content": "<p>Synthetix’s native token, SNX, is no longer inflationary following a successful SIP 2043 proposal which stopped the issuance of new tokens.</p><p>$SNX token holders have passed the proposal SIP-2043 to end the issuance of rewards in the form of newly-minted SNX tokens. In the future, Synthetix stakers will only receive rewards from trading fees, with the protocol set to introduce a buy-back and burn mechanism once its Andromeda upgrade is deployed on Base.</p><p>The rationale behind the proposal, published by Synthetix founder Kain Warwick, was that the effectiveness of inflation has diminished over time compared to the initial introduction which worked to incentivise liquidity and bootstrap the protocol. Additionally, the recently proposed buyback and burn experiments would be counter-intuitive if inflation continued.</p><p>The Synthetix team said that SNX will become deflationary following the rollout of Andromeda. Half of the trading fees generated from Andromeda will be used to purchase and burn SNX tokens, with stakers receiving the other 50% of fees as rewards.</p>",

            "content": "<p>Web3 digital credential data network <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/coins/project-galaxy/overview\">Galxe</a> tweeted that the website is now fully recovered and the team continues to enhance security.</p><p>On October 6, an unknown individual contacted Galxe's domain service provider Dynadot, impersonating an authorized Galxe member and bypassing the security process with falsified documentation. The impersonator then gained unauthorized access to the domain account, which was manipulated to redirect website visitors to a fake site and sign transactions that misappropriated their funds.</p><p>Galxe stated that the incident only affected its domain and front-end application. All Galxe smart contracts and technical systems remain secure and protected. All user information remains safe and unaffected.</p><p>To date, Galxe estimated that approximately 1,120 users who interacted with the malicious site were affected and about $270,000 was stolen. The team is actively working with legal enforcement and third-party experts to develop a fund recovery plan that will ensure everyone who is affected will be supported.</p><p><img src=\"https://s2.tokeninsight.com/static/calendar/img20231007044208310777ee-8581-496a-8a5d-5028ef68dcc6.jpg\"></p><p>Stay updated with the most important <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/news\">cryptocurrency news</a> and valuable insights, conveniently delivered to your email every day. <a rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\" target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://mailchi.mp/tokeninsight/newsletter\">Subscribe to the TokenInsight mailing list now!</a></p><p>Prefer social media?           {
            "timestamp": 1695218038000,
            "title": "One Mining Pool Controls 53% of Zcash's Hash Power, Prompting Double Spending Risk",
            "content": "<p>Mining Pool ViaBTC currently wields a substantial 53.8% of the <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/coins/zcash/overview\">Zcash</a> network's total hash rate, as reported by MiningPoolStats. This situation raises concerns, as it theoretically enables the mining pool to engage in malicious activities such as double spending attacks.</p><p>In response to this potential threat, exchanges like Coinbase have implemented precautionary measures. They now require 110 block confirmations before confirming ZEC deposits, resulting in a deposit time of approximately 2.5 hours. The primary objective behind this move is to mitigate the risk of double spending. Double-spending is the risk that a cryptocurrency can be used twice or more. This threat emerges when a single entity controls over 51% of the hash rate in a proof-of-work blockchain.</p><p>It's important to note that this dominance doesn't stem from a single miner but rather from a mining pool. Mining pools are collections of numerous miners who combine their computational resources to achieve a more consistent income. In the event that the mining pool engages in harmful activities, individual miners have the option to discontinue their association with the pool and seek alternatives.</p><p><img src=\"https://s2.tokeninsight.com/static/calendar/img20230920095354c957461a-da41-430b-be66-851268c66483.jpg\"></p><p>Stay updated with the most important <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/news\">cryptocurrency news</a> and valuable insights, conveniently delivered to your email every day. <a rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\" target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://mailchi.mp/tokeninsight/newsletter\">Subscribe to the TokenInsight mailing list now!</a></p><p>Prefer social media?             "content": "<p>Today marks the one-year anniversary of the <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/coins/ethereum/overview\">Ethereum</a> mainnet Merge. According to ultra sound money's data, the current supply of $ETH is around 120.2 million. Since the Ethereum Merge was completed on September 15, 2022, 980,323 $ETH has been burned, while 680,345 $ETH has been issued, reducing the supply by 299,978.</p><p>In addition, had the Merge not happened, the $ETH supply would have increased by more than 3.8 million over the past year.</p><figure class=\"image\"><img src=\"https://s2.tokeninsight.com/static/news/content/img/merge_one_year.png\"></figure><p><img src=\"https://s2.tokeninsight.com/static/calendar/img20230915043539e2e7fbdb-1b2f-47e5-a4e7-bbe1f3ac7ffc.jpg\"></p><p>Stay updated with the most important <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/news\">cryptocurrency news</a> and valuable insights, conveniently delivered to your email every day. <a rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\" target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://mailchi.mp/tokeninsight/newsletter\">Subscribe to the TokenInsight mailing list now!</a></p><p>Prefer social media?             "title": "Web3 Social Network DeSo Integrates with MetaMask",
            "content": "<p>Web3 social network DeSo announced that it has integrated with MetaMask, allowing MetaMask users to seamlessly create decentralized social identities. DeSo said this integration is possible because its derived keys allow controllable access-sharing of one’s account. In the case of MetaMask sign-up, DeSo use an unlimited derived key created and stored within the DeSo Identity. This unlimited derived key will allow the Identity to perform DeSo transactions on behalf of MetaMask’s main public key, with all the convenience of DeSo Identity API and particularly the background signing.</p><p>In addition, the authorized derived key transaction and all other transactions require at least 1000 Nanos (smallest unit of DeSo) to be written on the next block, so DeSo injected an airdrop payment of .001 DeSo to any eligible account after generating the public key from the MetaMask step and before submitting the authorize derived key transaction step.</p>",

The key benefits of Liquity include 0% interest rate, minimum collateral ratio of 110%, governance-free, directly redeemable, and fully decentralized.</p><p>$LUSD is the stablecoin used in the protocol while $LQTY is a secondary token that captures fee revenue and incentivizes early adopters.</p>",

Traders will be exempt from paying trading fees and earn 2,000 points per ETH.</p><p>Participants in deVamp will receive Vamp Badges, whereas those trying to game the system by depositing and immediately withdrawing will receive a sad pepe Quitter badge with a penalty of 4,000 points upon withdrawal.</p>",

          {
            "timestamp": 1705980271000,
            "title": "8% Ethereum Validators Went Down on Sunday, Sparking Worries on Client Diversity",
            "content": "<p>Reported by Coindesk, a bug in Ethereum's Nethermind client software – used by validators of the blockchain to interact with the network – knocked out a chunk of the chain's key operators on Sunday.</p><p>It was a manageable incident, but the episode revived a long-simmering debate in the Ethereum ecosystem around the need for \"client diversity.\" Some experts took the opportunity to point out how bad things could have been if another client software, Geth, the chain's most popular execution client, had gone out; the question is whether Ethereum could have kept going since Geth stands out as a possible single point of failure for the network.</p><p>Nethermind powers around 8% of the validators that operate Ethereum, and this weekend's bug was critical enough to pull those validators offline. Ethereum stayed up and running despite the issue, and Nethermind's developers released a patch fixing things within hours. The main consequence of the bug was that modest financial penalties fell onto some Nethermind-based validators.</p><p>Around 85% of Ethereum's validators are currently powered by Geth, and the recent outages to smaller execution clients have renewed concerns that Geth's dominant market position could pose grave consequences if there were ever issues with its programming.</p><p>Depending on the nature of the bug, a Geth glitch could halt the entire network, rendering it impossible for validators to add new blocks to the blockchain. Ethereum is also programmed to penalize validators that fall offline or break the network's rules, meaning thousands of Geth-based validators could be held financially liable in the event of a bug, and the penalties could get even bigger if the bug proves difficult to patch.</p>",
            "image_url": "https://s2.tokeninsight.com/static/news/cover/img/eth_staking2.png",
            "url": "https://tokeninsight.com/en/news/8-ethereum-validators-went-down-on-sunday-sparking-worries-on-client-diversity?utm_source=public&utm_medium=api&utm_campaign="

            "title": "EigenLayer Plans Shared Security Model, Re-stakes to be Used For All Network Services",
            "content": "<p>Reported by The Block, re-staking protocol EigenLayer plans to adopt a \"shared security\" system, a mechanism allowing protocols to join the network by leveraging a common pool of ETH stakes.</p><p>EigenLayer offers a protocol for users to deposit and \"re-stake\" ether from various liquid staking tokens, aiming to allocate those funds to secure third-party networks. The project's first stage was released on the Ethereum mainnet in June 2023.</p><p>In the future, the team intends to nudge the project into a major decentralized application platform and enable other projects to launch, leveraging the so-called shared security.</p><p>That version will enable the amount of ETH re-stakes on EigenLayer — currently over $1.7 billion — to be supplied to all services developed on the network simultaneously for the sake of a common security mechanism. This would make it economically unviable for an attacker to take down any given protocol.</p>",

            "timestamp": 1695094239000,
            "title": "Cosmos Project Canto to Migrate to a zk Layer 2 using Polygon CDK",
            "content": "<p><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/coins/canto/overview\">Canto</a>, a Layer 1 blockchain focused on decentralized finance, is migrating to a zero-knowledge Layer 2 on Ethereum powered by Polygon Chain Development Kit.</p><p>Canto is currently built using Cosmos SDK and provides an EVM execution layer and core financial primitives, including a decentralized exchange, lending market, and stablecoin(NOTE).</p><p>Polygon CDK is permissionless and open source tech that can be leveraged to design and build ZK chains. Chains designed with CDK retain independence without sacrificing modularity, and will join a unified ecosystem of ZK L2s connected to one another.</p><p><img src=\"https://s2.tokeninsight.com/static/calendar/img202309191130284e2ef48f-d87d-49d7-bcc0-e2759540e059.jpg\"></p><p>Stay updated with the most important <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/news\">cryptocurrency news</a> and valuable insights, conveniently delivered to your email every day. <a rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\" target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://mailchi.mp/tokeninsight/newsletter\">Subscribe to the TokenInsight mailing list now!</a></p><p>Prefer social media?             "timestamp": 1676254728000,
            "title": "Canto Governance to Vote on Reducing 30% Emissions and Liquidity Mining Incentives",
            "content": "<p><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/coins/canto/overview\">Canto</a>, the Layer 1 blockchain, is set to reduce its network emissions and liquidity mining incentives to improve the sustainability of its program and align its stakeholders. Two proposals will be submitted to the governance for approval.</p><p>The proposal to reduce security emissions will be submitted to governance on Monday, February 13th. The proposal to reduce liquidity mining incentives will be submitted to governance on Friday, February 17th.</p><p>The security emissions will be reduced by exactly 30% compared to the previous period, with an inflation rate of 5.6 $CANTO per block. Currently, 50% of the circulating $CANTO supply is staked for network security, this is at the higher end of the target range of 40-50% and the proposed adjustment is aimed at maintaining the staked supply ratio within the targeted range while decreasing the inflation rate.</p><p>The liquidity mining parameters will face a reduction across the board compared to the previous period, with liquidity mining incentives dropping to a total of 37.6 $CANTO per block. The allocation of liquidity mining rewards among DEX and lending market pools will be adjusted.</p><p>The new parameters will take effect immediately once the proposals are executed on-chain.</p><p>Want to learn more about Canto? Find our latest article: <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/research/analysts-pick/what-is-canto-why-is-it-making-waves-in-the-defi-world-ratings-analysis\">What is Canto &amp; Why is it Making Waves in the DeFi World? - Ratings &amp; Analysis</a></p>",

            "content": "<p>Stablecoin protocol <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/coins/reserversv/overview\">Reserve</a> will invest $20 million into the governance tokens of <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/coins/curve-finance/overview\">Curve</a> (CRV), <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/coins/convex-finance/overview\">Convex</a> (CVX) and Stake DAO (SDT). The investment is intended to increase the liquidity of Reserve's stablecoin RTokens, which will also increase Reserve's voting power in the governance systems of these protocols.</p><p>Reserve is a stablecoin protocol that allows users to create their own tokens backed by any assets they wish. Before the announcement, Reserve was already the seventh-largest holder of Convex tokens, behind only Mochi, Redacted, JPGd, Badger, Clever and FRAX. The protocol gained these tokens through the extensive use of Convex to earn yield for its users.</p><p>The Reserve team said this new $20 million investment could bring new features to RTokens, including \"collateralized loans, wallet products, tokenizing real world assets, and more transparent fintech systems.\"</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/cryptocurrencies\">TokenInsight</a> is dedicated to covering the most important and cutting-edge trends in the world of crypto. If you have information to share with us, please feel free to contact our email <a href=\"mailto:news@tokeninsight.com\">news@tokeninsight.com</a>. Your trust will be well respected.</p>",

            "title": "Gitcoin Launched a Liquid Staked $ETH Index, gtcETH",
            "content": "<p><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/coins/gitcoin/overview\">Gitcoin</a>, an organization that supports the funding of open-source software, has received initial liquidity for its Staked <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/coins/ethereum/overview\">$ETH</a> Index (<a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/coins/gitcoin-staked-eth-index/overview\">gtcETH</a>) after a successful community vote. The gtcETH is the first on-chain offering that enables holders to earn rewards from a diverse set of liquid staking tokens while simultaneously supporting the funding of digital public goods.</p><p>The gtcETH is built on Index Coop's EVM-based protocol and is composed of three tokens from the top liquid staking protocols on Ethereum, including <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/coins/lido-dao-token/overview\">Lido</a>, <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/coins/rocket-pool/overview\">Rocket Pool</a>, and <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/coins/stakewise/overview\">StakeWise</a>. These three liquid staking protocols were chosen based on several factors, including having a minimum of $25 million secondary market liquidity on Ethereum's mainnet and being open-source.</p><p>One of the motivations behind the gtcETH is the unpredictability associated with funding digital public goods, such as open-source code, blockchain, or open data sets. Without a clear profit motive, the funding for these goods is sometimes difficult to secure.</p><p>If the new index attracts users, it could provide a consistent revenue stream for Gitcoin to fund grants. Token holders of gtcETH incur an annualized streaming fee of 2%, with 1.75% going to the Gitcoin decentralized autonomous organization (DAO) and the remaining amount to Index Coop. According to Index Coop's snapshot vote, if gtcETH had a total value locked of $1 million, it would contribute roughly $17,500 a year to Gitcoin Grants, placing the index in the top ten in Gitcoin's Funders Leaderboard.</p>",

            "image_url": "https://s2.tokeninsight.com/static/news/cover/img/etherfi_vampire.png",
            "url": "https://tokeninsight.com/en/news/liquid-restaking-protocol-etherfi-launched-vampire-attack-strategy?utm_source=public&utm_medium=api&utm_campaign="
          },
          {
            "timestamp": 1706077463000,
            "title": "Uma Protocol Introduced Oval Allows DeFi Protocols to Capture Oracle Extractable Value",
            "content": "<p>Reported by The Block, blockchain project Uma has rolled out a solution called Oval, which aims to allow DeFi protocols to capture value that emerges during oracle updates by tapping into what’s known as oracle extractable value — a type of MEV generated when protocols request price updates from an oracle.</p><p>MEV involves extracting value by manipulating transaction order in a block on the Ethereum network, often with the aid of automated bots. This type of MEV arises either from the lack of liquidity across different decentralized exchanges or from their front-running each other under certain market conditions.</p><p>There is one type of MEV related to oracles, as Uma notes. In the decentralized finance niche — and in protocols such as lending or borrowing — oracles are crucial as they provide external data, like price feeds, to smart contracts. When an oracle update occurs, such as a price feed update, it can create MEV opportunities. For instance, if a lending protocol relies on an oracle for the latest asset prices, there may be a brief window post-update where a trader can leverage this information before the market responds.</p><p>“MEV is a major issue for Ethereum, with tens of millions of dollars extracted every year. OEV accounts for a big chunk of that because protocols need price updates,” Uma co-founder Hart Lambur said. “Oval addresses a real problem by helping protocols capture OEV. It’s been a privilege to work with Flashbots’ best-in-class team to bring Oval to mainnet.”</p><p>Oval's goal is to enable protocols, such as lending, to utilize this solution to retain and profit from this value rather than losing it to bots. In this setup, MEV searchers participate in an auction system, bidding for the right to access data from Chainlink oracles related to a certain protocol. The auction proceeds then benefit the protocol.</p>",
            "image_url": "https://s2.tokeninsight.com/static/news/cover/img/oval.png",
            "url": "https://tokeninsight.com/en/news/uma-protocol-introduced-oval-allows-defi-protocols-to-capture-oracle-extractable-value?utm_source=public&utm_medium=api&utm_campaign="

            "timestamp": 1705980271000,
            "title": "8% Ethereum Validators Went Down on Sunday, Sparking Worries on Client Diversity",
            "content": "<p>Reported by Coindesk, a bug in Ethereum's Nethermind client software – used by validators of the blockchain to interact with the network – knocked out a chunk of the chain's key operators on Sunday.</p><p>It was a manageable incident, but the episode revived a long-simmering debate in the Ethereum ecosystem around the need for \"client diversity.\" Some experts took the opportunity to point out how bad things could have been if another client software, Geth, the chain's most popular execution client, had gone out; the question is whether Ethereum could have kept going since Geth stands out as a possible single point of failure for the network.</p><p>Nethermind powers around 8% of the validators that operate Ethereum, and this weekend's bug was critical enough to pull those validators offline. Ethereum stayed up and running despite the issue, and Nethermind's developers released a patch fixing things within hours. The main consequence of the bug was that modest financial penalties fell onto some Nethermind-based validators.</p><p>Around 85% of Ethereum's validators are currently powered by Geth, and the recent outages to smaller execution clients have renewed concerns that Geth's dominant market position could pose grave consequences if there were ever issues with its programming.</p><p>Depending on the nature of the bug, a Geth glitch could halt the entire network, rendering it impossible for validators to add new blocks to the blockchain. Ethereum is also programmed to penalize validators that fall offline or break the network's rules, meaning thousands of Geth-based validators could be held financially liable in the event of a bug, and the penalties could get even bigger if the bug proves difficult to patch.</p>",
            "image_url": "https://s2.tokeninsight.com/static/news/cover/img/eth_staking2.png",

            "content": "<p>According to the TokenInsight Dashboard, multiple altcoins had an obvious increase in the market liquidity depth at major exchanges before yesterday's price jump.</p><p>Among the altcoins, <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/coins/litecoin/overview\">LTC</a> had one of the most significant buying order increases. The price of LTC then started going up a few hours later.</p><p><img src=\"https://s2.tokeninsight.com/static/calendar/img2023090804482358b13f37-12b4-4eae-a338-c4f2fc803f02.jpg\"></p><p>Before the price of <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/coins/ripple/overview\">XRP</a> began to rise from 2 pm UTC yesterday, its buying orders increased from $5.3 million at 8 am to more than $8 million at 10 am.</p><p><img src=\"https://s2.tokeninsight.com/static/calendar/img20230908044824cf3156a0-a116-4712-9a1b-4e83a70550c0.jpg\"></p><p>Similar to LTC and XRP, the bid orders of <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/coins/solana/overview\">SOL</a> and <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/coins/sui/overview\">SUI</a> have also increased significantly since around 9 am UTC yesterday. The aggregated depth chart of the tokens' bid and ask orders is obtained by aggregating the depth within a 1% price range from the five exchanges with the best liquidity: <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/exchanges/binance\">Binance</a>, <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/exchanges/coinbase\">Coinbase</a>, <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/exchanges/kraken\">Kraken</a>, <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/exchanges/bitfinex\">Bitfinex</a>, and <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/exchanges/kucoin\">KuCoin</a>. Changes in the depth of ask and bid orders in the order book may directly impact subsequent prices, but they can also be influenced by price fluctuations.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><ul><li>Stay updated with the most important <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/news\">cryptocurrency news</a> and valuable insights, conveniently delivered to your email every day. <a rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\" target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://mailchi.mp/tokeninsight/newsletter\">Subscribe to the TokenInsight mailing list now!</a></li><li>Prefer social media?             "content": "<p>The <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/coins/litecoin/overview\">Litecoin</a> Network, created in 2011 as a fork of Bitcoin, implemented its third mining-reward halving, reducing the pace of expansion in the supply of its native token, LTC.</p><p>Halving is a process by which the per-block reward given to miners in a crypto network for verifying transactions and adding blocks to the ledger is reduced by 50%. It's a feature in both the Litecoin and Bitcoin blockchains, which implement the halving roughly every four years.</p><p>Wednesday's change reduced the per-block LTC reward to 6.25 LTC from 12.5 LTC.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/cryptocurrencies\">TokenInsight</a> is dedicated to covering the most important and cutting-edge trends in the world of crypto.             "url": "https://tokeninsight.com/en/news/mdx-completes-second-halving-and-daily-output-down-to-1.15-million?utm_source=public&utm_medium=api&utm_campaign="
          },
          {
            "timestamp": 1706077463000,
            "title": "Uma Protocol Introduced Oval Allows DeFi Protocols to Capture Oracle Extractable Value",
            "content": "<p>Reported by The Block, blockchain project Uma has rolled out a solution called Oval, which aims to allow DeFi protocols to capture value that emerges during oracle updates by tapping into what’s known as oracle extractable value — a type of MEV generated when protocols request price updates from an oracle.</p><p>MEV involves extracting value by manipulating transaction order in a block on the Ethereum network, often with the aid of automated bots. This type of MEV arises either from the lack of liquidity across different decentralized exchanges or from their front-running each other under certain market conditions.</p><p>There is one type of MEV related to oracles, as Uma notes. In the decentralized finance niche — and in protocols such as lending or borrowing — oracles are crucial as they provide external data, like price feeds, to smart contracts. When an oracle update occurs, such as a price feed update, it can create MEV opportunities. For instance, if a lending protocol relies on an oracle for the latest asset prices, there may be a brief window post-update where a trader can leverage this information before the market responds.</p><p>“MEV is a major issue for Ethereum, with tens of millions of dollars extracted every year. OEV accounts for a big chunk of that because protocols need price updates,” Uma co-founder Hart Lambur said. “Oval addresses a real problem by helping protocols capture OEV. It’s been a privilege to work with Flashbots’ best-in-class team to bring Oval to mainnet.”</p><p>Oval's goal is to enable protocols, such as lending, to utilize this solution to retain and profit from this value rather than losing it to bots. In this setup, MEV searchers participate in an auction system, bidding for the right to access data from Chainlink oracles related to a certain protocol. The auction proceeds then benefit the protocol.</p>",
            "image_url": "https://s2.tokeninsight.com/static/news/cover/img/oval.png",
            "url": "https://tokeninsight.com/en/news/uma-protocol-introduced-oval-allows-defi-protocols-to-capture-oracle-extractable-value?utm_source=public&utm_medium=api&utm_campaign="
          }
        ],

        "review_time": 1669568517000,

            "timestamp": 1706077463000,
            "title": "Uma Protocol Introduced Oval Allows DeFi Protocols to Capture Oracle Extractable Value",
            "content": "<p>Reported by The Block, blockchain project Uma has rolled out a solution called Oval, which aims to allow DeFi protocols to capture value that emerges during oracle updates by tapping into what’s known as oracle extractable value — a type of MEV generated when protocols request price updates from an oracle.</p><p>MEV involves extracting value by manipulating transaction order in a block on the Ethereum network, often with the aid of automated bots. This type of MEV arises either from the lack of liquidity across different decentralized exchanges or from their front-running each other under certain market conditions.</p><p>There is one type of MEV related to oracles, as Uma notes. In the decentralized finance niche — and in protocols such as lending or borrowing — oracles are crucial as they provide external data, like price feeds, to smart contracts. When an oracle update occurs, such as a price feed update, it can create MEV opportunities. For instance, if a lending protocol relies on an oracle for the latest asset prices, there may be a brief window post-update where a trader can leverage this information before the market responds.</p><p>“MEV is a major issue for Ethereum, with tens of millions of dollars extracted every year. OEV accounts for a big chunk of that because protocols need price updates,” Uma co-founder Hart Lambur said. “Oval addresses a real problem by helping protocols capture OEV. It’s been a privilege to work with Flashbots’ best-in-class team to bring Oval to mainnet.”</p><p>Oval's goal is to enable protocols, such as lending, to utilize this solution to retain and profit from this value rather than losing it to bots. In this setup, MEV searchers participate in an auction system, bidding for the right to access data from Chainlink oracles related to a certain protocol. The auction proceeds then benefit the protocol.</p>",
            "image_url": "https://s2.tokeninsight.com/static/news/cover/img/oval.png",

          }

            "title": "TokenInsight: $MX, $BGB Have Best Performance among Exchange Tokens, $BNB Market Share Drops",
            "content": "<p>TokenInsight published Crypto Exchange Token Tracker Aug 2023 to reflect how major exchange tokens have been doing. According to the report, under the circumstances where the market cap of exchange tokens dropped, <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/exchanges/mexc-global\">MEXC</a>'s <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/coins/mx-token/overview\">$MX</a> and <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/coins/bitget-token/overview\">Bitget</a>'s <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/coins/bitget-token/overview\">$BGB</a> are the best-performing exchange tokens so far this year.</p><p>The market cap of the top 10 exchange tokens surged from $50B at the beginning of the year to a peak of $65B, before quickly retreating to below $50B. As of August 20, the total market cap of exchange tokens was about $43B, which represents about 4% of the global crypto market cap, down 1% from 5% at the end of Q1.</p><p><img src=\"https://s2.tokeninsight.com/static/calendar/img202308240610480a573aed-81d1-4360-af7b-98fbd4b0ca9a.jpg\"></p><p>Since the beginning of the year, $MX and $BGB recorded the largest price gains, up 234% and 134% respectively. <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/exchanges/okx\">OKX</a>'s <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/coins/okb/overview\">$OKB</a> increased 66.3% in price YTD, close to <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/coins/bitcoin/overview\">Bitcoin</a>'s return in 2023, while most exchange tokens underperformed compared to Bitcoin.</p><p><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/exchanges/binance\">Binance</a>'s <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/coins/binance-coin/overview\">$BNB</a> is still the largest exchange token. But affected by a series of regulatory events, its market cap dropped 15% from the beginning of the year, currently at $33B. Correspondingly, the market share of $BNB dropped from 82% to 77.5%. Among all the major exchange tokens,<a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/coins/huobi-token/overview\"> $HT</a> experienced the steepest decline, with its market cap eroding by more than 50%.</p><p><img src=\"https://s2.tokeninsight.com/static/calendar/img202308240610492fd07d64-2328-4d07-b418-88eb01bb8311.jpg\"></p><p>To learn more about exchange tokens' performance, please read: <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/research/reports/crypto-exchange-token-tracker-aug-2023\">Crypto Exchange Token Tracker Aug 2023</a></p><p><img src=\"https://s2.tokeninsight.com/static/calendar/img20230824061137c729af71-335f-4f67-a128-39e0f9d6ecd4.jpg\"></p><ul><li>Stay updated with the most important <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/news\">cryptocurrency news</a> and valuable insights, conveniently delivered to your email every day. <a rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\" target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://mailchi.mp/tokeninsight/newsletter\">Subscribe to the TokenInsight mailing list now!</a></li><li>Prefer social media?           {
            "timestamp": 1706077463000,
            "title": "Uma Protocol Introduced Oval Allows DeFi Protocols to Capture Oracle Extractable Value",
            "content": "<p>Reported by The Block, blockchain project Uma has rolled out a solution called Oval, which aims to allow DeFi protocols to capture value that emerges during oracle updates by tapping into what’s known as oracle extractable value — a type of MEV generated when protocols request price updates from an oracle.</p><p>MEV involves extracting value by manipulating transaction order in a block on the Ethereum network, often with the aid of automated bots. This type of MEV arises either from the lack of liquidity across different decentralized exchanges or from their front-running each other under certain market conditions.</p><p>There is one type of MEV related to oracles, as Uma notes. In the decentralized finance niche — and in protocols such as lending or borrowing — oracles are crucial as they provide external data, like price feeds, to smart contracts. When an oracle update occurs, such as a price feed update, it can create MEV opportunities. For instance, if a lending protocol relies on an oracle for the latest asset prices, there may be a brief window post-update where a trader can leverage this information before the market responds.</p><p>“MEV is a major issue for Ethereum, with tens of millions of dollars extracted every year. OEV accounts for a big chunk of that because protocols need price updates,” Uma co-founder Hart Lambur said. “Oval addresses a real problem by helping protocols capture OEV. It’s been a privilege to work with Flashbots’ best-in-class team to bring Oval to mainnet.”</p><p>Oval's goal is to enable protocols, such as lending, to utilize this solution to retain and profit from this value rather than losing it to bots. In this setup, MEV searchers participate in an auction system, bidding for the right to access data from Chainlink oracles related to a certain protocol. The auction proceeds then benefit the protocol.</p>",
            "image_url": "https://s2.tokeninsight.com/static/news/cover/img/oval.png",
            "url": "https://tokeninsight.com/en/news/uma-protocol-introduced-oval-allows-defi-protocols-to-capture-oracle-extractable-value?utm_source=public&utm_medium=api&utm_campaign="

            "timestamp": 1705980271000,
            "title": "8% Ethereum Validators Went Down on Sunday, Sparking Worries on Client Diversity",
            "content": "<p>Reported by Coindesk, a bug in Ethereum's Nethermind client software – used by validators of the blockchain to interact with the network – knocked out a chunk of the chain's key operators on Sunday.</p><p>It was a manageable incident, but the episode revived a long-simmering debate in the Ethereum ecosystem around the need for \"client diversity.\" Some experts took the opportunity to point out how bad things could have been if another client software, Geth, the chain's most popular execution client, had gone out; the question is whether Ethereum could have kept going since Geth stands out as a possible single point of failure for the network.</p><p>Nethermind powers around 8% of the validators that operate Ethereum, and this weekend's bug was critical enough to pull those validators offline. Ethereum stayed up and running despite the issue, and Nethermind's developers released a patch fixing things within hours. The main consequence of the bug was that modest financial penalties fell onto some Nethermind-based validators.</p><p>Around 85% of Ethereum's validators are currently powered by Geth, and the recent outages to smaller execution clients have renewed concerns that Geth's dominant market position could pose grave consequences if there were ever issues with its programming.</p><p>Depending on the nature of the bug, a Geth glitch could halt the entire network, rendering it impossible for validators to add new blocks to the blockchain. Ethereum is also programmed to penalize validators that fall offline or break the network's rules, meaning thousands of Geth-based validators could be held financially liable in the event of a bug, and the penalties could get even bigger if the bug proves difficult to patch.</p>",
            "image_url": "https://s2.tokeninsight.com/static/news/cover/img/eth_staking2.png",
            "url": "https://tokeninsight.com/en/news/8-ethereum-validators-went-down-on-sunday-sparking-worries-on-client-diversity?utm_source=public&utm_medium=api&utm_campaign="
          }

            "timestamp": 1705977114000,
            "title": "EigenLayer Plans Shared Security Model, Re-stakes to be Used For All Network Services",
            "content": "<p>Reported by The Block, re-staking protocol EigenLayer plans to adopt a \"shared security\" system, a mechanism allowing protocols to join the network by leveraging a common pool of ETH stakes.</p><p>EigenLayer offers a protocol for users to deposit and \"re-stake\" ether from various liquid staking tokens, aiming to allocate those funds to secure third-party networks. The project's first stage was released on the Ethereum mainnet in June 2023.</p><p>In the future, the team intends to nudge the project into a major decentralized application platform and enable other projects to launch, leveraging the so-called shared security.</p><p>That version will enable the amount of ETH re-stakes on EigenLayer — currently over $1.7 billion — to be supplied to all services developed on the network simultaneously for the sake of a common security mechanism. This would make it economically unviable for an attacker to take down any given protocol.</p>",

          {
            "timestamp": 1705980271000,
            "title": "8% Ethereum Validators Went Down on Sunday, Sparking Worries on Client Diversity",
            "content": "<p>Reported by Coindesk, a bug in Ethereum's Nethermind client software – used by validators of the blockchain to interact with the network – knocked out a chunk of the chain's key operators on Sunday.</p><p>It was a manageable incident, but the episode revived a long-simmering debate in the Ethereum ecosystem around the need for \"client diversity.\" Some experts took the opportunity to point out how bad things could have been if another client software, Geth, the chain's most popular execution client, had gone out; the question is whether Ethereum could have kept going since Geth stands out as a possible single point of failure for the network.</p><p>Nethermind powers around 8% of the validators that operate Ethereum, and this weekend's bug was critical enough to pull those validators offline. Ethereum stayed up and running despite the issue, and Nethermind's developers released a patch fixing things within hours. The main consequence of the bug was that modest financial penalties fell onto some Nethermind-based validators.</p><p>Around 85% of Ethereum's validators are currently powered by Geth, and the recent outages to smaller execution clients have renewed concerns that Geth's dominant market position could pose grave consequences if there were ever issues with its programming.</p><p>Depending on the nature of the bug, a Geth glitch could halt the entire network, rendering it impossible for validators to add new blocks to the blockchain. Ethereum is also programmed to penalize validators that fall offline or break the network's rules, meaning thousands of Geth-based validators could be held financially liable in the event of a bug, and the penalties could get even bigger if the bug proves difficult to patch.</p>",

            "content": "<p>Bitcoin mining pool AntPool has agreed to refund the record-breaking $3 million transactionfee it mined last week.             "title": "Bitcoin Decentralized Mining Pool OCEAN Raised $6.3M, Led by Jack Dorsey",
            "content": "<p>OCEAN, a new decentralized Bitcoin mining pool, announced that it had raised $6.3 million in seed funding from various sources on Nov. 28. The seed funding round is notably led by Jack Dorsey, co-founder and CEO of Block Inc. and also a co-founder and former CEO of Twitter/X.</p><p>\"OCEAN is solving a problem for Bitcoiners that I think all of us feel—further centralization of mining pools that could plague Bitcoin, and how that risks a bunch of Bitcoin attributes that we hold dear,\" said Jack Dorsey.</p><p>The OCEAM mining pool is the first non-custodial platform where miners receive block rewards directly from the coinbase transaction, eliminating the risk associated with traditional pools withholding payments from individual miners.</p><p>OCEAN is also aiming to solve several major problems facing bitcoin mining. The most significant one is the problem of centralization of block template construction.</p><p>“Even though hashrate may be distributed globally, the reality is that the intelligent parts of mining (running a full node, sourcing transactions, constructing the block template) are performed by very few individuals and the pools that they control,” said OCEAN's Global Head of Sales, Bitcoin Mechanic. “This is a disproportionate level of influence by too few over too many and has the potential to hurt Bitcoin.” After the launch, OCEAN will introduce a way for miners to independently perform block template construction while still reaping the economic benefits of being in a pool.</p>",

            "content": "<p>F2Pool, the 3rd largest Bitcoin mining pool, might be censoring transactions from an address subject to U.S. Government sanctions.</p><p>The Bitcoin development-focused blogger 0xB10C wrote No.20 that his \"miningpool-observer\" project \"detected six missing transactions spending from OFAC-sanctioned addresses.\" OFAC stands for the Office of Foreign Assets Control, a U.S. Government agency efforts to enforce economic sanctions.</p><p>\"The transactions missing from F2Pool's block are, however, likely filtered.\" according to the blogger.</p><p>A mining pool is a group of cryptocurrency miners who combine their computational resources over a network to strengthen the probability of finding a block or successfully mining for cryptocurrency. And participants in a mining pool can, relatively easily, switch to a different pool.</p><p>F2Pool is responsible for about 14% of mined Bitcoin blocks over the past year, the third-most after Foundry USA's 30% and AntPool's 22%, based on data from Blockchain.com.</p>",

            "timestamp": 1705980271000,
            "title": "8% Ethereum Validators Went Down on Sunday, Sparking Worries on Client Diversity",
            "content": "<p>Reported by Coindesk, a bug in Ethereum's Nethermind client software – used by validators of the blockchain to interact with the network – knocked out a chunk of the chain's key operators on Sunday.</p><p>It was a manageable incident, but the episode revived a long-simmering debate in the Ethereum ecosystem around the need for \"client diversity.\" Some experts took the opportunity to point out how bad things could have been if another client software, Geth, the chain's most popular execution client, had gone out; the question is whether Ethereum could have kept going since Geth stands out as a possible single point of failure for the network.</p><p>Nethermind powers around 8% of the validators that operate Ethereum, and this weekend's bug was critical enough to pull those validators offline. Ethereum stayed up and running despite the issue, and Nethermind's developers released a patch fixing things within hours. The main consequence of the bug was that modest financial penalties fell onto some Nethermind-based validators.</p><p>Around 85% of Ethereum's validators are currently powered by Geth, and the recent outages to smaller execution clients have renewed concerns that Geth's dominant market position could pose grave consequences if there were ever issues with its programming.</p><p>Depending on the nature of the bug, a Geth glitch could halt the entire network, rendering it impossible for validators to add new blocks to the blockchain. Ethereum is also programmed to penalize validators that fall offline or break the network's rules, meaning thousands of Geth-based validators could be held financially liable in the event of a bug, and the penalties could get even bigger if the bug proves difficult to patch.</p>",
            "image_url": "https://s2.tokeninsight.com/static/news/cover/img/eth_staking2.png",
