            "title": "EigenLayer Plans Shared Security Model, Re-stakes to be Used For All Network Services",
            "content": "<p>Reported by The Block, re-staking protocol EigenLayer plans to adopt a \"shared security\" system, a mechanism allowing protocols to join the network by leveraging a common pool of ETH stakes.</p><p>EigenLayer offers a protocol for users to deposit and \"re-stake\" ether from various liquid staking tokens, aiming to allocate those funds to secure third-party networks. The project's first stage was released on the Ethereum mainnet in June 2023.</p><p>In the future, the team intends to nudge the project into a major decentralized application platform and enable other projects to launch, leveraging the so-called shared security.</p><p>That version will enable the amount of ETH re-stakes on EigenLayer — currently over $1.7 billion — to be supplied to all services developed on the network simultaneously for the sake of a common security mechanism. This would make it economically unviable for an attacker to take down any given protocol.</p>",

            "content": "<p>Reported by The Defiant, Rocket Pool's rETH is dominating trading volume among liquid staking tokens. Data from IntoTheBlock shows rETH accounting for more than half of the liquid staking sector's volume over the past three weeks. The token drove $28.8M worth of trades compared to stETH's $6.7M.</p><p>The data also shows increasing activity surrounding Frax's FrxETH and sFraxETH.</p><p><img src=\"https://s2.tokeninsight.com/static/calendar/img20231120113546e483ebd0-e2df-4c5a-8501-b94d93c4f7db.jpg\"></p><p>The surge in rETH activity could be attributed to the launch of Prisma Finance's LST-backed stablecoin, mkUSD, alongside adoption incentives in the form of its native PRISMA token, according to research by IntoTheBlock.</p><p>“We looked into it on-chain, and it appears that the spike in rETH volumes the past few weeks is linked to the launch of PRISMA,” said Lucas Outumuro, Head of Research at IntoTheBlock. “They increased the supply caps on Nov. 2 and launched their token as incentives for people to mint mkUSD through the protocol.</p><p>\"This appears to have increased demand for rETH, with deposits into Prisma spiking that day.”</p><p>Outumouro added that the jump in rETH demand from Prisma users drove up the token’s price, opening up arbitrage strategies for opportunistic traders.</p><p>“There was a lot of volume since rETH was bought on the market, driving its price to a premium relative to its ETH holdings, and then more volume to arbitrage the price back down,” he said.</p>",

            "title": "Ethereum Liquid Staking Protocols Impose Self-Limiting Rule on Market Share",
            "content": "<p>Reported Cointelegraph, at least five Ethereum liquid staking providers have either imposed or are working to impose a self-limit rule in which they promise not to own more than 22% of the Ethereum staking market — seen as a move to ensure the Ethereum network remains decentralized.</p><p>Among the Ethereum staking providers either already committed or are working to commit to the self-limit rule include <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/coins/rocket-pool/overview\">Rocket Pool</a>, <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/coins/stakewise/overview\">StakeWise</a>, <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/coins/stader/overview\">Stader</a> Labs and Diva Staking, according to Ethereum core developer Superphiz.</p><p>Puffer Finance, another liquid staking service, also announced its commitment to the self-limit.</p><p>The proposal presumably aims to address concerns of Ethereum staking becoming increasingly centralized.</p><p>Interestingly, the largest Ethereum liquid staking provider, Lido Finance, voted by a 99.81% majority not to self-limit back last June.</p><p><img src=\"https://s2.tokeninsight.com/static/calendar/img20230901034523455be87a-5df3-41d8-8810-74c0a63028a5.jpg\"></p><p>Stay updated with the most important <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/news\">cryptocurrency news</a> and valuable insights, conveniently delivered to your email every day. <a rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\" target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://mailchi.mp/tokeninsight/newsletter\">Subscribe to the TokenInsight mailing list now!</a></p><p>Prefer social media?             "content": "<p>Stablecoin protocol Prisma Finance announced its successful deployment on the <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/coins/ethereum/overview\">Ethereum</a> mainnet. The protocol will be accessible to users today at 9 am UTC.</p><p>Prisma Finance allows users to use $ETH liquid staking tokens (LST) as collateral to mint the protocol's stablecoin, $mkUSD, and supports $wstETH, $rETH, $sfrxETH, and $cbETH as collateral. The protocol is undergoing a Guarded Launch and initially, there's a debt cap for each collateral. The total amount of $mkUSD mintable for each collateral is $6 million for $wstETH, $rETH, and $sfrxETH, and $2 million for $cbETH.</p><p>After the Guarded Launch, Prisma Finance will launch its token $PRISMA, which can be locked by users to receive $vePRISMA, allowing them to participate in governance and boost their $PRISMA emissions.</p><p>Related: <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/news/stablecoin-protocol-prisma-finance-raises-funds-from-curve-founder-okx-ventures-and-others\">Stablecoin Protocol Prisma Finance Raises Funds from Curve Founder, OKX Ventures and Others</a></p><p><img src=\"https://s2.tokeninsight.com/static/calendar/img20230901024741110e5edf-b5bd-4557-bc27-dd9cfed69935.jpg\"></p><ul><li>Stay updated with the most important <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/news\">cryptocurrency news</a> and valuable insights, conveniently delivered to your email every day. <a rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\" target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://mailchi.mp/tokeninsight/newsletter\">Subscribe to the TokenInsight mailing list now!</a></li><li>Prefer social media?             "title": "Aave to Convert 1,600 ETH in DAO Treasury to $wstETH and $rETH",
            "content": "<p>The <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/coins/aave/overview\">Aave</a> community has approved a governance proposal regarding the DAO treasury management, which will convert most <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/coins/ethereum/overview\">$ETH</a> in the DAO treasury to $wstETH and <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/coins/rocket-pool-eth/overview\">$rETH</a> to increase yields. 100% of the voting power is in favor of the proposal.</p><p>According to the proposal, Aave DAO will convert 1,400 $awETH, 104 $ETH and 96 $aEthWETH to 800 <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/coins/lido-staked-ether/overview\">$stETH </a>and 800 $rETH, then wrap the $stETH into $wstETH. The $wstETH and $rETH will be transferred into the Collector contract.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/cryptocurrencies\">TokenInsight</a> is dedicated to covering the most important and cutting-edge trends in the world of crypto.             "title": "TokenInsight: Top10 Exchanges' Trading Volume in Q3 2023 Down 23% Than Q2",
            "content": "<p>TokenInsight released Crypto Exchange Report 2023Q3. The report selected the Top10 centralized exchanges and summarized their data performance, aiming to help users understand the changes in the exchange market.</p><p>The report shows that in Q3, the total trading volume of Top10 exchanges was $6.1 trillion, a 23% decrease from $8.3 trillion in Q2. Coincidentally, the second quarter's trading volume also dropped 23% from Q1's $10.4 trillion. If this trend continues, the total trading volume in Q4 will be less than $5 trillion. It's worth noting that the total trading volume of Top10 exchanges in September was only $1.67 trillion, the lowest in the past year. In addition, the spot trading volume of the Top10 spot exchanges was $1 trillion, down 24.4% from Q2; the derivatives trading volume of the Top10 derivatives exchanges was $5.2 trillion, down 22.4%.</p><p><img src=\"https://s2.tokeninsight.com/static/calendar/img20231018103051f8701034-fc83-4945-823c-b4b933da64e2.jpg\"></p><p>Binance's total trading volume in Q3 was $3.2 trillion. Although its market share decreased by 1.87% compared to the previous quarter, it's still in the leading position with a 53.4% market share. Exchanges such as OKX, Bybit, Bitget, and Coinbase achieved market share growth in the quarter.</p><p>Among the six exchanges that provide both spot and derivatives services, only Gate maintains a relatively high spot trading volume share of more than 30% (32%).             "content": "<p>After two consecutive weeks of relatively low trading volume, the weekly trading volume of top exchanges returned to above $400 billion last week (October 1-October 7), reaching approximately $435.7 billion, a 15.8% increase compared to the previous week, <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/dashboard/exchange/total-volume\">TokenInsight Dashboard</a> shows. The market share is 14.40%</li><li>Coinbase: $5.87 billion, up 20.8%. The market share is 1.38%</li><li>Bitget: $29.59 billion, up 14.9%. The market share is 6.96%</li></ul><p>Note: TokenInsight has selected some exchanges based on <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/zh/exchanges?type=centralized\">our database</a> to calculate the total trading volume, instead of including all exchanges.             "timestamp": 1695218038000,
            "title": "One Mining Pool Controls 53% of Zcash's Hash Power, Prompting Double Spending Risk",
            "content": "<p>Mining Pool ViaBTC currently wields a substantial 53.8% of the <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/coins/zcash/overview\">Zcash</a> network's total hash rate, as reported by MiningPoolStats. This situation raises concerns, as it theoretically enables the mining pool to engage in malicious activities such as double spending attacks.</p><p>In response to this potential threat, exchanges like Coinbase have implemented precautionary measures. They now require 110 block confirmations before confirming ZEC deposits, resulting in a deposit time of approximately 2.5 hours. The primary objective behind this move is to mitigate the risk of double spending. Double-spending is the risk that a cryptocurrency can be used twice or more. This threat emerges when a single entity controls over 51% of the hash rate in a proof-of-work blockchain.</p><p>It's important to note that this dominance doesn't stem from a single miner but rather from a mining pool. Mining pools are collections of numerous miners who combine their computational resources to achieve a more consistent income. In the event that the mining pool engages in harmful activities, individual miners have the option to discontinue their association with the pool and seek alternatives.</p><p><img src=\"https://s2.tokeninsight.com/static/calendar/img20230920095354c957461a-da41-430b-be66-851268c66483.jpg\"></p><p>Stay updated with the most important <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/news\">cryptocurrency news</a> and valuable insights, conveniently delivered to your email every day. <a rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\" target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://mailchi.mp/tokeninsight/newsletter\">Subscribe to the TokenInsight mailing list now!</a></p><p>Prefer social media?             "timestamp": 1695182740000,
            "title": "CoinEx Private Keys Compromise Leads to $70 Million Hack",
            "content": "<p>Hong Kong-based crypto exchange <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/exchanges/coinex\">CoinEx</a> said hackers stole more than $70 million in tokens as a result of compromised private keys. The team wanted to open lines of communication to claw back funds and stated that affected users would be compensated entirely for any lost funds.</p><p>CoinEx's initial investigation into the hack blamed the root cause on a compromised private key for its hot wallets. These private keys store exchange assets used for deposits and withdrawals. In order to avoid further losses, CoinEx suspended the withdrawal service, fixed the system vulnerabilities, and transferred the remaining assets from the affected hot wallets. Withdrawal services are expected to gradually resume within seven working days.</p><p>The exchange explained that a preliminary investigation pinned the root cause to a compromised private key for its hot wallets.</p><p>CoinEx says its team is still investigating the identity of the person responsible for the security breach, and some blockchain security firms believe the attacker to be North Korean hackers Lazarus Group.</p><p>Related: <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/news/crypto-exchange-coinex-hacked-for-nearly-27m\">Crypto Exchange CoinEX Hacked for Nearly $27M</a></p><p><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/news/coinex-suspends-deposit-and-withdrawal-services-promises-to-compensate-affected-parties\">CoinEx Suspends Deposit and Withdrawal Services, Promises to Compensate Affected Parties</a></p><p><img src=\"https://s2.tokeninsight.com/static/calendar/img2023092012021661264d5c-7278-4dc9-990b-5b547a0a2bfc.jpg\"></p><p>Stay updated with the most important <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/news\">cryptocurrency news</a> and valuable insights, conveniently delivered to your email every day. <a rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\" target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://mailchi.mp/tokeninsight/newsletter\">Subscribe to the TokenInsight mailing list now!</a></p><p>Prefer social media?           {
            "timestamp": 1706077463000,
            "title": "Uma Protocol Introduced Oval Allows DeFi Protocols to Capture Oracle Extractable Value",
            "content": "<p>Reported by The Block, blockchain project Uma has rolled out a solution called Oval, which aims to allow DeFi protocols to capture value that emerges during oracle updates by tapping into what’s known as oracle extractable value — a type of MEV generated when protocols request price updates from an oracle.</p><p>MEV involves extracting value by manipulating transaction order in a block on the Ethereum network, often with the aid of automated bots. This type of MEV arises either from the lack of liquidity across different decentralized exchanges or from their front-running each other under certain market conditions.</p><p>There is one type of MEV related to oracles, as Uma notes. In the decentralized finance niche — and in protocols such as lending or borrowing — oracles are crucial as they provide external data, like price feeds, to smart contracts. When an oracle update occurs, such as a price feed update, it can create MEV opportunities. For instance, if a lending protocol relies on an oracle for the latest asset prices, there may be a brief window post-update where a trader can leverage this information before the market responds.</p><p>“MEV is a major issue for Ethereum, with tens of millions of dollars extracted every year. OEV accounts for a big chunk of that because protocols need price updates,” Uma co-founder Hart Lambur said. “Oval addresses a real problem by helping protocols capture OEV. It’s been a privilege to work with Flashbots’ best-in-class team to bring Oval to mainnet.”</p><p>Oval's goal is to enable protocols, such as lending, to utilize this solution to retain and profit from this value rather than losing it to bots. In this setup, MEV searchers participate in an auction system, bidding for the right to access data from Chainlink oracles related to a certain protocol. The auction proceeds then benefit the protocol.</p>",
            "image_url": "https://s2.tokeninsight.com/static/news/cover/img/oval.png",
            "url": "https://tokeninsight.com/en/news/uma-protocol-introduced-oval-allows-defi-protocols-to-capture-oracle-extractable-value?utm_source=public&utm_medium=api&utm_campaign="
          }
        ],
        "update_time": 1706544153000,
        "review_time": 1698313035000,

          "Oracle",

            "timestamp": 1706253504000,
            "title": "Decentralized Sequencer Espresso System Launched Gibraltar Testnet",
            "content": "<p>Decentralized sequencer protocol Espresso system launched fourth testnet, Gibraltar testnet, and is publicly available for Arbitrum developers.</p><p>Layer 2 Sequencers are responsible for processing and ordering transactions from a mempool into blocks. They can be compared to validators on monolithic blockchains or layer-1 networks, and play an important role in securing the network.</p><p>The problem with sequencers today is that many rollups run their own sequencers with their own execution environments, and zero-knowledge solutions run their own provers. Thai introduces trust assumptions and centralization concerns.</p><p>In addition to making it possible for Arbitrum developers to test their dapps using the shared sequencer network, the Gibraltar testnet will also see external node operators run the network for the first time.</p><p>Espresso provides a shared sequencer network, a distributed consensus system shared between rollups — which has so far already been integrated with Optimism, Cartesi and Polygon zkEVM via testnet</p>",

          {
            "timestamp": 1705980271000,
            "title": "8% Ethereum Validators Went Down on Sunday, Sparking Worries on Client Diversity",
            "content": "<p>Reported by Coindesk, a bug in Ethereum's Nethermind client software – used by validators of the blockchain to interact with the network – knocked out a chunk of the chain's key operators on Sunday.</p><p>It was a manageable incident, but the episode revived a long-simmering debate in the Ethereum ecosystem around the need for \"client diversity.\" Some experts took the opportunity to point out how bad things could have been if another client software, Geth, the chain's most popular execution client, had gone out; the question is whether Ethereum could have kept going since Geth stands out as a possible single point of failure for the network.</p><p>Nethermind powers around 8% of the validators that operate Ethereum, and this weekend's bug was critical enough to pull those validators offline. Ethereum stayed up and running despite the issue, and Nethermind's developers released a patch fixing things within hours. The main consequence of the bug was that modest financial penalties fell onto some Nethermind-based validators.</p><p>Around 85% of Ethereum's validators are currently powered by Geth, and the recent outages to smaller execution clients have renewed concerns that Geth's dominant market position could pose grave consequences if there were ever issues with its programming.</p><p>Depending on the nature of the bug, a Geth glitch could halt the entire network, rendering it impossible for validators to add new blocks to the blockchain. Ethereum is also programmed to penalize validators that fall offline or break the network's rules, meaning thousands of Geth-based validators could be held financially liable in the event of a bug, and the penalties could get even bigger if the bug proves difficult to patch.</p>",
            "image_url": "https://s2.tokeninsight.com/static/news/cover/img/eth_staking2.png",
            "url": "https://tokeninsight.com/en/news/8-ethereum-validators-went-down-on-sunday-sparking-worries-on-client-diversity?utm_source=public&utm_medium=api&utm_campaign="
          }

            "title": "EigenLayer Plans Shared Security Model, Re-stakes to be Used For All Network Services",
            "content": "<p>Reported by The Block, re-staking protocol EigenLayer plans to adopt a \"shared security\" system, a mechanism allowing protocols to join the network by leveraging a common pool of ETH stakes.</p><p>EigenLayer offers a protocol for users to deposit and \"re-stake\" ether from various liquid staking tokens, aiming to allocate those funds to secure third-party networks. The project's first stage was released on the Ethereum mainnet in June 2023.</p><p>In the future, the team intends to nudge the project into a major decentralized application platform and enable other projects to launch, leveraging the so-called shared security.</p><p>That version will enable the amount of ETH re-stakes on EigenLayer — currently over $1.7 billion — to be supplied to all services developed on the network simultaneously for the sake of a common security mechanism. This would make it economically unviable for an attacker to take down any given protocol.</p>",

            "content": "<p>Reported by The Defiant, Frax Finance has unveiled Frax Bonds (FXB), a utility token that converts into 1 FRAX stablecoin trustlessly upon maturity. The launch marks the completion of Frax’s v3 roadmap, deploying all its new features.</p><p>“FXBs are a way to buy future FRAX stablecoins at a particular timestamp for a discount today,” said the team. Their expectation is that bond yields will mirror U.S Treasury rates for similar maturities with the caveat that FXBs “do not guarantee that right, do not confer any legal redeemability assumptions (other than for $FRAX stablecoin tokens).”</p><p>Frax Bonds will be usable across DeFi, including Curve Finance pools, trading pairs that are looking for leverage, and trustless debt repayment.</p><p>The community behind the stablecoin protocol voted in late December to deploy $20M of its collateral to U.S. Treasuries.             "title": "Axelar Launches Interchain Token Service to Improve Interoperability, with SushiSwap Adopting ",
            "content": "<p>Cross-chain interoperability protocol <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/coins/axelar/overview\">Axelar</a> announced the launch of Interchain Token Service, which aims to enhance the interoperability of ERC-20 tokens across EVM compatible chains.</p><p>The service is a product suite to mint and manage Interchain Tokens, which provide tokens cross-chain fungibility and custom functionality. Tokens using Interchain Token can avoid security risks and compatibility issues brought by the bridged token versions.</p><p>According to Axelar, <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/coins/sushiswap/overview\">SushiSwap</a> has adopted Interchain Token to facilitate seamless interaction of $SUSHI across multiple chains. SushiSwap CEO Jared Grey said, \"Axelar's Interchain Token Service unlocks a more seamless, interchain experience for Sushi users. Currently, there are many bridged versions of $SUSHI that lack fungibility and carry bridge risk. With Interchain Tokens, Sushi can achieve true cross-chain interoperability, simply and securely.\"</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/cryptocurrencies\">TokenInsight</a> is dedicated to covering the most important and cutting-edge trends in the world of crypto.             "timestamp": 1695218038000,
            "title": "One Mining Pool Controls 53% of Zcash's Hash Power, Prompting Double Spending Risk",
            "content": "<p>Mining Pool ViaBTC currently wields a substantial 53.8% of the <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/coins/zcash/overview\">Zcash</a> network's total hash rate, as reported by MiningPoolStats. This situation raises concerns, as it theoretically enables the mining pool to engage in malicious activities such as double spending attacks.</p><p>In response to this potential threat, exchanges like Coinbase have implemented precautionary measures. They now require 110 block confirmations before confirming ZEC deposits, resulting in a deposit time of approximately 2.5 hours. The primary objective behind this move is to mitigate the risk of double spending. Double-spending is the risk that a cryptocurrency can be used twice or more. This threat emerges when a single entity controls over 51% of the hash rate in a proof-of-work blockchain.</p><p>It's important to note that this dominance doesn't stem from a single miner but rather from a mining pool. Mining pools are collections of numerous miners who combine their computational resources to achieve a more consistent income. In the event that the mining pool engages in harmful activities, individual miners have the option to discontinue their association with the pool and seek alternatives.</p><p><img src=\"https://s2.tokeninsight.com/static/calendar/img20230920095354c957461a-da41-430b-be66-851268c66483.jpg\"></p><p>Stay updated with the most important <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/news\">cryptocurrency news</a> and valuable insights, conveniently delivered to your email every day. <a rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\" target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://mailchi.mp/tokeninsight/newsletter\">Subscribe to the TokenInsight mailing list now!</a></p><p>Prefer social media?             "timestamp": 1705980271000,
            "title": "8% Ethereum Validators Went Down on Sunday, Sparking Worries on Client Diversity",
            "content": "<p>Reported by Coindesk, a bug in Ethereum's Nethermind client software – used by validators of the blockchain to interact with the network – knocked out a chunk of the chain's key operators on Sunday.</p><p>It was a manageable incident, but the episode revived a long-simmering debate in the Ethereum ecosystem around the need for \"client diversity.\" Some experts took the opportunity to point out how bad things could have been if another client software, Geth, the chain's most popular execution client, had gone out; the question is whether Ethereum could have kept going since Geth stands out as a possible single point of failure for the network.</p><p>Nethermind powers around 8% of the validators that operate Ethereum, and this weekend's bug was critical enough to pull those validators offline. Ethereum stayed up and running despite the issue, and Nethermind's developers released a patch fixing things within hours. The main consequence of the bug was that modest financial penalties fell onto some Nethermind-based validators.</p><p>Around 85% of Ethereum's validators are currently powered by Geth, and the recent outages to smaller execution clients have renewed concerns that Geth's dominant market position could pose grave consequences if there were ever issues with its programming.</p><p>Depending on the nature of the bug, a Geth glitch could halt the entire network, rendering it impossible for validators to add new blocks to the blockchain. Ethereum is also programmed to penalize validators that fall offline or break the network's rules, meaning thousands of Geth-based validators could be held financially liable in the event of a bug, and the penalties could get even bigger if the bug proves difficult to patch.</p>",
            "image_url": "https://s2.tokeninsight.com/static/news/cover/img/eth_staking2.png",

            "timestamp": 1681908583000,
            "title": "Fetch.ai to Offer AI Trading Tools for Decentralized Exchanges",
            "content": "<p><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/coins/fetch-ai/overview\">Fetch.ai</a>, a U.K.-based <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/news?tag=AI\">artificial intelligence</a> (AI) tool developer for crypto, is launching a new suite of trading products for decentralized exchanges (DEX). The company aims to facilitate peer-to-peer transactions between DeFi users using AI-powered \"agents\" to execute trades based on user-defined parameters.</p><p>The suite of trading tools will be rolled out later this quarter. The users submit their orders to the agent, which then puts them in escrow or an atomic transaction while it finds matching orders. The platform's strength lies in its ability to find and create liquidity, where agents collaborate to create decentralized order books. The absence of a liquidity pool means there is no trove of coins for hackers to target.</p><p>Fetch.ai is aiming to mitigate the risk of smart contract exploitation and rug pulls in DEXs using individual agents. These agents utilize their own smart contracts to execute users' instructions, reducing the likelihood of malicious activity in a DEX.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/cryptocurrencies\">TokenInsight</a> is dedicated to covering the most important and cutting-edge trends in the world of crypto.             "content": "<p>The <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/coins/conic-finance/overview\">Conic protocol</a> has launched, bringing Omnipools to the <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/coins/curve-finance/overview\">Curve</a> ecosystem. LPs can now diversify their exposure across Curve by depositing into an Omnipool. This new feature allows the allocation of liquidity of a single asset into different Curve pools, while all Curve LP tokens get staked on Convex to boost <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/coins/curve-finance/overview\">$CRV</a> earnings and receive <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/coins/convex-finance/overview\">$CVX.</a></p><p>Conic Finance is a new platform designed to make it easy for liquidity providers to diversify their exposure across multiple Curve pools. Conic Finance does not charge any deposit or withdrawal fees, and there are no performance fees on $CRV and $CVX tokens. Users can deposit a single token into a Conic pool, and the protocol will then allocate it across multiple approved Curve pools, and stake the Curve pool LP tokens on Convex. This results in LPs receiving Conic Finance LP tokens, which are representative of their share of liquidity across multiple Curve pools. LPs also receive $CRV, $CVX, and $CNC tokens.</p><p>Conic Finance is a community-led project with no VCs involved.</p>",

            "timestamp": 1694744222000,
            "title": "SSV.Network Launched Public Mainnet",
            "content": "<p><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/coins/ssv-network/overview\">SSV.network</a> launched its public mainnet on September 14th, attracting over 10 staking decentralized applications that have deployed their platforms on the network.</p><p>The goal of this DVT (distributed validator technology) is to bring greater decentralization to the current staking provider landscape, which is currently dominated by a handful of ETH staking pools holding a significant share of ETH locked in the staking contract.</p><p>This technology divides a private key, used to secure a validator, among a cluster of computers. This approach enhances security and allows certain nodes within a validator cluster to go offline, reducing single points of failure and fortifying validator sets.</p><p>Through the distribution of keyshares among a diverse set of nodes in a cluster, validators achieve a higher degree of decentralization. Staking pools can utilize DVT to decentralize their own infrastructure or delegate this task to SSV.network node operators.</p><p><img src=\"https://s2.tokeninsight.com/static/calendar/img202309151016413ad82980-da87-4dd1-80a2-5d555cda0834.jpg\"></p><p>Stay updated with the most important <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/news\">cryptocurrency news</a> and valuable insights, conveniently delivered to your email every day. <a rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\" target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://mailchi.mp/tokeninsight/newsletter\">Subscribe to the TokenInsight mailing list now!</a></p><p>Prefer social media?             "timestamp": 1688484245000,
            "title": "$ETH Staking Network ssv.network Enters First Phase of Mainnet Launch",
            "content": "<p><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/coins/ethereum/overview\">$ETH</a> staking network <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/coins/ssv-network/overview\">ssv.network </a>announced its mainnet launch plan, which is divided into 4 phases: Pre-Launch, Limited Launch, Launch and Permissionless Launch. Currently, ssv.network is at the first phase.</p><p>The main goal of Pre-Launch is to ensure all mainnet parameters are correctly configured. During this phase, both operators and validators are run by the core team. Entering Limited Launch, ssv.network will introduce verified external operators and ensure active participation from the operators. Only the core team can stake $ETH during the first two phases.</p><p>During the Launch phase, ssv.network will onboard launch partners, and $ETH staking will be enabled through the partners. ssv.network will be fully open in Permissionless Launch, when everyone can join the network. This phase is expected to arrive in Q4 2023.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/cryptocurrencies\">TokenInsight</a> is dedicated to covering the most important and cutting-edge trends in the world of crypto.             "content": "<p><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/coins/ssv-network/overview\">ssv.network</a> announced Jato, the latest iteration of their public testnet. Jato serves as their mainnet candidate and offers major gas cost optimization, improved validator account management, and an increase in the number of nodes that run a validator. Moreover, it introduces private networks for tailored user bases, more customization, and more control over staking operations.</p><p>The introduction of Jato is an essential step towards achieving ssv.network's vision of decentralizing Ethereum's proof-of-stake (PoS) consensus, where the majority of staked ETH must run through Distributed Validator Technology (DVT). With Jato taking the reins, ssv.network will make the final steps toward their goal of scaling the number of validators and the nodes operating inside it.</p><p>SSV.network is a fully decentralized and open ETH staking network that uses Secret Shared Validators (SSV) to split a validator key for ETH staking between non-trusting nodes or operators.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/cryptocurrencies\">TokenInsight</a> is dedicated to covering the most important and cutting-edge trends in the world of crypto.             "content": "<p>NFT aggregation marketplace <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/coins/rarible/overview\">Rarible</a> announced it will stop aggregating orders from OpenSea, <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/coins/looksrare/overview\">LooksRare</a>, and <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/coins/x2y2/overview\">X2Y2</a>, because it supports royalties, while all the three marketplaces mentioned use optional royalties.</p><p>\"The principle of royalties is at the heart of decentralization—a continual affirmation of a creator's value in every transaction.             "title": "Nexo Sues Cayman Islands Monetary Authority over Rejected Virtual Asset License",
            "content": "<p><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/coins/nexo/overview\">Nexo</a> sued the Cayman Islands Monetary Authority (CIMA) after its application for a virtual asset license was denied.</p><p>Nexo lawyers argue the CIMA's decision was procedurally unfair and that the regulator also breached its constitutional and statutory duties by not informing Nexo the detailed reason for the rejection. Nexo not only wants the CIMA decision reversed, but it also wants the court to rule that CIMA to register it.</p><p>Previously, the CIMA rejected Nexo's application on Dec. 20, saying the firm's business model did not meet the required risk profile. \"Nexo posed a risk to market confidence, consumer protection and the reputation of the Islands as a financial centre. And Nexo directors and shareholders had failed to disclosure to the CIMA potential regulatory enforcement matter in the U.S. and proceedings in English courts.\"</p>",

Using Cross-Chain Transfer Protocol, when a user initiates a sending of $USDC from one chain to another, the $USDC on the source chain will be sent to a smart contract and be burned, not locked. Then the same amount of $USDC will be minted natively on the destination chain.</p><p>Cross-Chain Transfer Protocol will be launched in January 2023. When it's live on cBridge mainnet, users will be able to transfer $USDC natively between <a href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/coins/ethereum/overview\" target=\"_blank\">Ethereum</a> and Avalanche.</p>",

            "content": "<p>NFT aggregation marketplace <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/coins/rarible/overview\">Rarible</a> announced it will stop aggregating orders from OpenSea, <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/coins/looksrare/overview\">LooksRare</a>, and <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/coins/x2y2/overview\">X2Y2</a>, because it supports royalties, while all the three marketplaces mentioned use optional royalties.</p><p>\"The principle of royalties is at the heart of decentralization—a continual affirmation of a creator's value in every transaction. We stand in solidarity with creators and artists. That's why we will no longer support marketplaces that neglect royalties,\" Rarible said in the statement.</p><p>Last week, OpenSea announced it would sunset Operator Filter, its royalty enforcement tool, and move to optional royalties on all secondary sales for new collections starting from August 31.</p><p>Related: <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/news/opensea-gives-up-on-royalty-enforcement-switches-to-optional-royalty-on-august-31\">OpenSea Gives Up on Royalty Enforcement, Switches to Optional Royalty on August 31</a></p><p><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/news/yuga-labs-to-stop-support-for-seaport-in-opposition-to-opensea-s-switch-to-optional-royalties\">Yuga Labs to Stop Support for SeaPort in Opposition to OpenSea's Switch to Optional Royalties</a></p><p><img src=\"https://s2.tokeninsight.com/static/calendar/img202308220810288ba74c69-a3ff-4ab7-835a-b2222520088e.jpg\"></p><ul><li>Stay updated with the most important <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/news\">cryptocurrency news</a> and valuable insights, conveniently delivered to your email every day. <a rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\" target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://mailchi.mp/tokeninsight/newsletter\">Subscribe to the TokenInsight mailing list now!</a></li><li>Prefer social media? With Gnosis Pay, users can spend their digital assets directly from crypto wallets wherever Visa is accepted. Gnosis Pay uses a custom Layer2 built on Gnosis Chain to enable more secure and cheaper transactions.</p><p>Gnosis Card is the first Visa-certified, self-custodial consumer debit card. Built on Gnosis Pay, it directly links to an onchain wallet instead of a traditional bank account.             "title": "Irys Considers Fork Arweave, Stops Dataset Maintenance",
            "content": "<p>Arweave founder Sam Williams tweeted that that Arweave storage ecosystem solution Irys (formerly Bundlr Network) is considering forking Arweave, dropping dataset maintenance and resetting the token supply. The ar.io network plans to remove Irys bundlers from the Arweave main gateway’s trusted set, leading to severe delays before user data becomes available.</p><p>Williams opined that forking makes sense for a permanent storage network by saving and building on the state rather than breaking it, which will only result in the unachievable goal of information permanence where all data is periodically discarded. He added that the only reason for Irys to fork could be greed and hopes that Irys will fork the right way.</p><p>Responding to the Arweave founder’s “Irys plans to fork Arweave” narrative, Irys tweeted that it is tragically ironic that Sam Williams, whose life’s work has been to make Arweave open-source and permissionless software, is trying to rip Irys out of Arweave. Irys has never and will never take away users’ choice of where their data is stored.</p><p>Irys processes about 95% of Arweave transactions and has been referred to as an Arweave scaling solution.             "content": "<p>smlXL, a startup focusing on blockchain infrastructure, announced it has raised $13.4 million in a seed funding round led by <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/capitals/a16z-andreessen-horowitz\">a16z</a>, with participation from Grelock and others.</p><p>smlXL aims to make blockchain more transparent, useful, and accessible. It started launching Instrumented Ethereum Virtual Machine (iEVM) in April 2022, which is used for simulating and instrumenting blockchains. It allows developers to offload computations off-chain, performing them in an iEVM simulation to reduce costs.             "timestamp": 1698135648000,
            "title": "Binance's Bitcoin Orderbook Liquidity Surged Before Price Increase",
            "content": "<p>Affected by the latest reports related to the spot <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/coins/bitcoin/overview\">Bitcoin</a> ETF, the price of Bitcoin began to rise yesterday, jumping from around $31,000 to briefly exceeding $35,000. According to the <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/dashboard/market-liquidity/exchanges-orderbook\">TokenInsight Dashboard</a>, the orderbook liquidity of the BTC/USDT trading pair on <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/exchanges/binance\">Binance</a> surged before the price increase, with the total amount of buy and sell orders exceeding $100 million within an hour twice.</p><p><img src=\"https://s2.tokeninsight.com/static/calendar/img202310240416311fd8de3d-d7df-4160-ab10-6e26c6ab98a4.jpg\"></p><p>From 15:00 to 16:00 UTC on October 23, the total amount of buy and sell orders for the BTC/USDT trading pair on Binance exceeded $114 million, an increase of 5.5 times compared to $17.7 million two hours ago. Two hours later, the amount of Bitcoin buy and sell orders on Binance once again went beyond $100 million. The surge in order book liquidity was mainly due to the increasing buy orders. In both periods mentioned above, Binance's Bitcoin buy orders were more than $92 million.</p><p><img src=\"https://s2.tokeninsight.com/static/calendar/img2023102404163133a73c2d-4c80-4c52-914d-3f9521ded5c4.jpg\"></p><p>It is worth mentioning that other major exchanges have not seen a significant increase in liquidity during the Bitcoin price jump. Currently, the two Bitcoin trading pairs with the highest market share are both from Binance, namely BTC/USDT and BTC/FDUSD. In the past 24 hours, the trading volume of these two trading pairs was over $7.1 billion, with market shares of 16.6% and 11.87% respectively.</p><p>TokenInsight's Exchanges Orderbook Liquidity Comparison Chart is obtained by aggregating the depth within a 1% price range from the six exchanges with the best liquidity: <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/exchanges/binance\">Binance</a>, <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/exchanges/coinbase\">Coinbase</a>, <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/exchanges/kraken\">Kraken</a>, <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/exchanges/bitfinex\">Bitfinex</a>, <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/exchanges/bitget\">Bitget</a>, and <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/exchanges/kucoin\">KuCoin</a>. If you want to understand the specific selection rules for each trading pair on these exchanges, data calculation rules, and how to interpret the above chart, check <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/tokenwiki/all/what-is-order-book-liquidity-how-can-you-compare-liquidity-data-from-major-exchanges-through-tokeninsight\">Learn what liquidity is, methodology of data calculation, and how to read the charts.</a></p><p><img src=\"https://s2.tokeninsight.com/static/calendar/img20231024041637786342e2-bdd0-4783-bd63-8601903d4e4e.jpg\"></p><p>Stay updated with the most important <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/news\">cryptocurrency news</a> and valuable insights, conveniently delivered to your email every day. <a rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\" target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://mailchi.mp/tokeninsight/newsletter\">Subscribe to the TokenInsight mailing list now!</a></p><p>Prefer social media?             "timestamp": 1705980271000,
            "title": "8% Ethereum Validators Went Down on Sunday, Sparking Worries on Client Diversity",
            "content": "<p>Reported by Coindesk, a bug in Ethereum's Nethermind client software – used by validators of the blockchain to interact with the network – knocked out a chunk of the chain's key operators on Sunday.</p><p>It was a manageable incident, but the episode revived a long-simmering debate in the Ethereum ecosystem around the need for \"client diversity.\" Some experts took the opportunity to point out how bad things could have been if another client software, Geth, the chain's most popular execution client, had gone out; the question is whether Ethereum could have kept going since Geth stands out as a possible single point of failure for the network.</p><p>Nethermind powers around 8% of the validators that operate Ethereum, and this weekend's bug was critical enough to pull those validators offline. Ethereum stayed up and running despite the issue, and Nethermind's developers released a patch fixing things within hours. The main consequence of the bug was that modest financial penalties fell onto some Nethermind-based validators.</p><p>Around 85% of Ethereum's validators are currently powered by Geth, and the recent outages to smaller execution clients have renewed concerns that Geth's dominant market position could pose grave consequences if there were ever issues with its programming.</p><p>Depending on the nature of the bug, a Geth glitch could halt the entire network, rendering it impossible for validators to add new blocks to the blockchain. Ethereum is also programmed to penalize validators that fall offline or break the network's rules, meaning thousands of Geth-based validators could be held financially liable in the event of a bug, and the penalties could get even bigger if the bug proves difficult to patch.</p>",

            "content": "<p>Reported by The Block, re-staking protocol EigenLayer plans to adopt a \"shared security\" system, a mechanism allowing protocols to join the network by leveraging a common pool of ETH stakes.</p><p>EigenLayer offers a protocol for users to deposit and \"re-stake\" ether from various liquid staking tokens, aiming to allocate those funds to secure third-party networks. The project's first stage was released on the Ethereum mainnet in June 2023.</p><p>In the future, the team intends to nudge the project into a major decentralized application platform and enable other projects to launch, leveraging the so-called shared security.</p><p>That version will enable the amount of ETH re-stakes on EigenLayer — currently over $1.7 billion — to be supplied to all services developed on the network simultaneously for the sake of a common security mechanism. This would make it economically unviable for an attacker to take down any given protocol.</p>",

        "token_performance": "45.20%",
        "ecosystem_development": "45.30%",
        "team_partners_investors": "44.67%",
        "token_economics": "36.00%",
        "roadmap_progress": "86.53%",
        "related_news": [
          {
            "timestamp": 1706077463000,
            "title": "Uma Protocol Introduced Oval Allows DeFi Protocols to Capture Oracle Extractable Value",
            "content": "<p>Reported by The Block, blockchain project Uma has rolled out a solution called Oval, which aims to allow DeFi protocols to capture value that emerges during oracle updates by tapping into what’s known as oracle extractable value — a type of MEV generated when protocols request price updates from an oracle.</p><p>MEV involves extracting value by manipulating transaction order in a block on the Ethereum network, often with the aid of automated bots. This type of MEV arises either from the lack of liquidity across different decentralized exchanges or from their front-running each other under certain market conditions.</p><p>There is one type of MEV related to oracles, as Uma notes. In the decentralized finance niche — and in protocols such as lending or borrowing — oracles are crucial as they provide external data, like price feeds, to smart contracts. When an oracle update occurs, such as a price feed update, it can create MEV opportunities. For instance, if a lending protocol relies on an oracle for the latest asset prices, there may be a brief window post-update where a trader can leverage this information before the market responds.</p><p>“MEV is a major issue for Ethereum, with tens of millions of dollars extracted every year. OEV accounts for a big chunk of that because protocols need price updates,” Uma co-founder Hart Lambur said. “Oval addresses a real problem by helping protocols capture OEV. It’s been a privilege to work with Flashbots’ best-in-class team to bring Oval to mainnet.”</p><p>Oval's goal is to enable protocols, such as lending, to utilize this solution to retain and profit from this value rather than losing it to bots. In this setup, MEV searchers participate in an auction system, bidding for the right to access data from Chainlink oracles related to a certain protocol. The auction proceeds then benefit the protocol.</p>",

Their expectation is that bond yields will mirror U.S Treasury rates for similar maturities with the caveat that FXBs “do not guarantee that right, do not confer any legal redeemability assumptions (other than for $FRAX stablecoin tokens).”</p><p>Frax Bonds will be usable across DeFi, including Curve Finance pools, trading pairs that are looking for leverage, and trustless debt repayment.</p><p>The community behind the stablecoin protocol voted in late December to deploy $20M of its collateral to U.S. Treasuries.             "content": "<p>Synthetix’s native token, SNX, is no longer inflationary following a successful SIP 2043 proposal which stopped the issuance of new tokens.</p><p>$SNX token holders have passed the proposal SIP-2043 to end the issuance of rewards in the form of newly-minted SNX tokens. In the future, Synthetix stakers will only receive rewards from trading fees, with the protocol set to introduce a buy-back and burn mechanism once its Andromeda upgrade is deployed on Base.</p><p>The rationale behind the proposal, published by Synthetix founder Kain Warwick, was that the effectiveness of inflation has diminished over time compared to the initial introduction which worked to incentivise liquidity and bootstrap the protocol. Additionally, the recently proposed buyback and burn experiments would be counter-intuitive if inflation continued.</p><p>The Synthetix team said that SNX will become deflationary following the rollout of Andromeda. Half of the trading fees generated from Andromeda will be used to purchase and burn SNX tokens, with stakers receiving the other 50% of fees as rewards.</p>",

          {
            "timestamp": 1706077463000,
            "title": "Uma Protocol Introduced Oval Allows DeFi Protocols to Capture Oracle Extractable Value",
            "content": "<p>Reported by The Block, blockchain project Uma has rolled out a solution called Oval, which aims to allow DeFi protocols to capture value that emerges during oracle updates by tapping into what’s known as oracle extractable value — a type of MEV generated when protocols request price updates from an oracle.</p><p>MEV involves extracting value by manipulating transaction order in a block on the Ethereum network, often with the aid of automated bots. This type of MEV arises either from the lack of liquidity across different decentralized exchanges or from their front-running each other under certain market conditions.</p><p>There is one type of MEV related to oracles, as Uma notes. In the decentralized finance niche — and in protocols such as lending or borrowing — oracles are crucial as they provide external data, like price feeds, to smart contracts. When an oracle update occurs, such as a price feed update, it can create MEV opportunities. For instance, if a lending protocol relies on an oracle for the latest asset prices, there may be a brief window post-update where a trader can leverage this information before the market responds.</p><p>“MEV is a major issue for Ethereum, with tens of millions of dollars extracted every year. OEV accounts for a big chunk of that because protocols need price updates,” Uma co-founder Hart Lambur said. “Oval addresses a real problem by helping protocols capture OEV. It’s been a privilege to work with Flashbots’ best-in-class team to bring Oval to mainnet.”</p><p>Oval's goal is to enable protocols, such as lending, to utilize this solution to retain and profit from this value rather than losing it to bots. In this setup, MEV searchers participate in an auction system, bidding for the right to access data from Chainlink oracles related to a certain protocol. The auction proceeds then benefit the protocol.</p>",
            "image_url": "https://s2.tokeninsight.com/static/news/cover/img/oval.png",
            "url": "https://tokeninsight.com/en/news/uma-protocol-introduced-oval-allows-defi-protocols-to-capture-oracle-extractable-value?utm_source=public&utm_medium=api&utm_campaign="

            "timestamp": 1705980271000,
            "title": "8% Ethereum Validators Went Down on Sunday, Sparking Worries on Client Diversity",
            "content": "<p>Reported by Coindesk, a bug in Ethereum's Nethermind client software – used by validators of the blockchain to interact with the network – knocked out a chunk of the chain's key operators on Sunday.</p><p>It was a manageable incident, but the episode revived a long-simmering debate in the Ethereum ecosystem around the need for \"client diversity.\" Some experts took the opportunity to point out how bad things could have been if another client software, Geth, the chain's most popular execution client, had gone out; the question is whether Ethereum could have kept going since Geth stands out as a possible single point of failure for the network.</p><p>Nethermind powers around 8% of the validators that operate Ethereum, and this weekend's bug was critical enough to pull those validators offline. Ethereum stayed up and running despite the issue, and Nethermind's developers released a patch fixing things within hours. The main consequence of the bug was that modest financial penalties fell onto some Nethermind-based validators.</p><p>Around 85% of Ethereum's validators are currently powered by Geth, and the recent outages to smaller execution clients have renewed concerns that Geth's dominant market position could pose grave consequences if there were ever issues with its programming.</p><p>Depending on the nature of the bug, a Geth glitch could halt the entire network, rendering it impossible for validators to add new blocks to the blockchain. Ethereum is also programmed to penalize validators that fall offline or break the network's rules, meaning thousands of Geth-based validators could be held financially liable in the event of a bug, and the penalties could get even bigger if the bug proves difficult to patch.</p>",

            "content": "<p>OCEAN, a new decentralized Bitcoin mining pool, announced that it had raised $6.3 million in seed funding from various sources on Nov. 28. The seed funding round is notably led by Jack Dorsey, co-founder and CEO of Block Inc. and also a co-founder and former CEO of Twitter/X.</p><p>\"OCEAN is solving a problem for Bitcoiners that I think all of us feel—further centralization of mining pools that could plague Bitcoin, and how that risks a bunch of Bitcoin attributes that we hold dear,\" said Jack Dorsey.</p><p>The OCEAM mining pool is the first non-custodial platform where miners receive block rewards directly from the coinbase transaction, eliminating the risk associated with traditional pools withholding payments from individual miners.</p><p>OCEAN is also aiming to solve several major problems facing bitcoin mining. The most significant one is the problem of centralization of block template construction.</p><p>“Even though hashrate may be distributed globally, the reality is that the intelligent parts of mining (running a full node, sourcing transactions, constructing the block template) are performed by very few individuals and the pools that they control,” said OCEAN's Global Head of Sales, Bitcoin Mechanic. “This is a disproportionate level of influence by too few over too many and has the potential to hurt Bitcoin.” After the launch, OCEAN will introduce a way for miners to independently perform block template construction while still reaping the economic benefits of being in a pool.</p>",

            "url": "https://tokeninsight.com/en/news/liquid-restaking-protocol-etherfi-launched-vampire-attack-strategy?utm_source=public&utm_medium=api&utm_campaign="
          },
          {
            "timestamp": 1706077463000,
            "title": "Uma Protocol Introduced Oval Allows DeFi Protocols to Capture Oracle Extractable Value",
            "content": "<p>Reported by The Block, blockchain project Uma has rolled out a solution called Oval, which aims to allow DeFi protocols to capture value that emerges during oracle updates by tapping into what’s known as oracle extractable value — a type of MEV generated when protocols request price updates from an oracle.</p><p>MEV involves extracting value by manipulating transaction order in a block on the Ethereum network, often with the aid of automated bots. This type of MEV arises either from the lack of liquidity across different decentralized exchanges or from their front-running each other under certain market conditions.</p><p>There is one type of MEV related to oracles, as Uma notes. In the decentralized finance niche — and in protocols such as lending or borrowing — oracles are crucial as they provide external data, like price feeds, to smart contracts. When an oracle update occurs, such as a price feed update, it can create MEV opportunities. For instance, if a lending protocol relies on an oracle for the latest asset prices, there may be a brief window post-update where a trader can leverage this information before the market responds.</p><p>“MEV is a major issue for Ethereum, with tens of millions of dollars extracted every year. OEV accounts for a big chunk of that because protocols need price updates,” Uma co-founder Hart Lambur said. “Oval addresses a real problem by helping protocols capture OEV. It’s been a privilege to work with Flashbots’ best-in-class team to bring Oval to mainnet.”</p><p>Oval's goal is to enable protocols, such as lending, to utilize this solution to retain and profit from this value rather than losing it to bots. In this setup, MEV searchers participate in an auction system, bidding for the right to access data from Chainlink oracles related to a certain protocol. The auction proceeds then benefit the protocol.</p>",
            "image_url": "https://s2.tokeninsight.com/static/news/cover/img/oval.png",
            "url": "https://tokeninsight.com/en/news/uma-protocol-introduced-oval-allows-defi-protocols-to-capture-oracle-extractable-value?utm_source=public&utm_medium=api&utm_campaign="
          },
          {
            "timestamp": 1705980271000,
            "title": "8% Ethereum Validators Went Down on Sunday, Sparking Worries on Client Diversity",
            "content": "<p>Reported by Coindesk, a bug in Ethereum's Nethermind client software – used by validators of the blockchain to interact with the network – knocked out a chunk of the chain's key operators on Sunday.</p><p>It was a manageable incident, but the episode revived a long-simmering debate in the Ethereum ecosystem around the need for \"client diversity.\" Some experts took the opportunity to point out how bad things could have been if another client software, Geth, the chain's most popular execution client, had gone out; the question is whether Ethereum could have kept going since Geth stands out as a possible single point of failure for the network.</p><p>Nethermind powers around 8% of the validators that operate Ethereum, and this weekend's bug was critical enough to pull those validators offline. Ethereum stayed up and running despite the issue, and Nethermind's developers released a patch fixing things within hours. The main consequence of the bug was that modest financial penalties fell onto some Nethermind-based validators.</p><p>Around 85% of Ethereum's validators are currently powered by Geth, and the recent outages to smaller execution clients have renewed concerns that Geth's dominant market position could pose grave consequences if there were ever issues with its programming.</p><p>Depending on the nature of the bug, a Geth glitch could halt the entire network, rendering it impossible for validators to add new blocks to the blockchain. Ethereum is also programmed to penalize validators that fall offline or break the network's rules, meaning thousands of Geth-based validators could be held financially liable in the event of a bug, and the penalties could get even bigger if the bug proves difficult to patch.</p>",
            "image_url": "https://s2.tokeninsight.com/static/news/cover/img/eth_staking2.png",
            "url": "https://tokeninsight.com/en/news/8-ethereum-validators-went-down-on-sunday-sparking-worries-on-client-diversity?utm_source=public&utm_medium=api&utm_campaign="
          },

            "timestamp": 1705977114000,
            "title": "EigenLayer Plans Shared Security Model, Re-stakes to be Used For All Network Services",
            "content": "<p>Reported by The Block, re-staking protocol EigenLayer plans to adopt a \"shared security\" system, a mechanism allowing protocols to join the network by leveraging a common pool of ETH stakes.</p><p>EigenLayer offers a protocol for users to deposit and \"re-stake\" ether from various liquid staking tokens, aiming to allocate those funds to secure third-party networks. The project's first stage was released on the Ethereum mainnet in June 2023.</p><p>In the future, the team intends to nudge the project into a major decentralized application platform and enable other projects to launch, leveraging the so-called shared security.</p><p>That version will enable the amount of ETH re-stakes on EigenLayer — currently over $1.7 billion — to be supplied to all services developed on the network simultaneously for the sake of a common security mechanism. This would make it economically unviable for an attacker to take down any given protocol.</p>",
            "image_url": "https://s2.tokeninsight.com/static/news/cover/img/EL.png",

            "content": "<p>Ethereum restaking protocol EigenLayer says it will introduce three new LSTs into the EigenLayer restaking ecosystem: sfrxETH, mETH and LsETH, and is removing the 200,000 ETH cap on LSTs.</p><p>In addition, the team is introducing a new way to distribute restaking points that will cap the amount of restaking points that can be distributed to any one LST, LRT or individual depositor to 33% of the total issuance going forward.</p><p>The team will open the restaking window from February 5th 12pm PT to 9th 12pm PT with the new LSTs sfrxETH, mETH and LsETH and no cap on any LST, after which all deposits will once again be paused.</p>",

            "title": "Liquid Restaking Protocol EtherFi Launched Vampire Attack Strategy",
            "content": "<p>Reported by The Defiant, Liquid restaking protocol EtherFi has launched ‘deVamp’ in a bid to incentivize users to swap their existing Eigenlayer deposits for its eETH liquid restaking token (LRT).</p><p>Users that restaked Lido’s stETH, Coinbase’s cbETH, and Binance’s wBETH on Eigenlayer can now instantly swap their deposits into liquid eETH, avoiding the 7-day delay on withdrawals put in place by the highly anticipated restaking protocol.</p><p>With deVamp, users will receive 3,000 loyalty points per restaked ETH migrated into eETH.</p><p>Additionally, holders of these liquid staking tokens (LSTs) can swap them for eETH and earn points on the deVamp website. Traders will be exempt from paying trading fees and earn 2,000 points per ETH.</p><p>Participants in deVamp will receive Vamp Badges, whereas those trying to game the system by depositing and immediately withdrawing will receive a sad pepe Quitter badge with a penalty of 4,000 points upon withdrawal.</p>",

          },
          {
            "timestamp": 1706077463000,
            "title": "Uma Protocol Introduced Oval Allows DeFi Protocols to Capture Oracle Extractable Value",
            "content": "<p>Reported by The Block, blockchain project Uma has rolled out a solution called Oval, which aims to allow DeFi protocols to capture value that emerges during oracle updates by tapping into what’s known as oracle extractable value — a type of MEV generated when protocols request price updates from an oracle.</p><p>MEV involves extracting value by manipulating transaction order in a block on the Ethereum network, often with the aid of automated bots. This type of MEV arises either from the lack of liquidity across different decentralized exchanges or from their front-running each other under certain market conditions.</p><p>There is one type of MEV related to oracles, as Uma notes. In the decentralized finance niche — and in protocols such as lending or borrowing — oracles are crucial as they provide external data, like price feeds, to smart contracts. When an oracle update occurs, such as a price feed update, it can create MEV opportunities. For instance, if a lending protocol relies on an oracle for the latest asset prices, there may be a brief window post-update where a trader can leverage this information before the market responds.</p><p>“MEV is a major issue for Ethereum, with tens of millions of dollars extracted every year. OEV accounts for a big chunk of that because protocols need price updates,” Uma co-founder Hart Lambur said. “Oval addresses a real problem by helping protocols capture OEV. It’s been a privilege to work with Flashbots’ best-in-class team to bring Oval to mainnet.”</p><p>Oval's goal is to enable protocols, such as lending, to utilize this solution to retain and profit from this value rather than losing it to bots. In this setup, MEV searchers participate in an auction system, bidding for the right to access data from Chainlink oracles related to a certain protocol. The auction proceeds then benefit the protocol.</p>",
            "image_url": "https://s2.tokeninsight.com/static/news/cover/img/oval.png",
            "url": "https://tokeninsight.com/en/news/uma-protocol-introduced-oval-allows-defi-protocols-to-capture-oracle-extractable-value?utm_source=public&utm_medium=api&utm_campaign="
          },
          {
            "timestamp": 1705980271000,
            "title": "8% Ethereum Validators Went Down on Sunday, Sparking Worries on Client Diversity",
            "content": "<p>Reported by Coindesk, a bug in Ethereum's Nethermind client software – used by validators of the blockchain to interact with the network – knocked out a chunk of the chain's key operators on Sunday.</p><p>It was a manageable incident, but the episode revived a long-simmering debate in the Ethereum ecosystem around the need for \"client diversity.\" Some experts took the opportunity to point out how bad things could have been if another client software, Geth, the chain's most popular execution client, had gone out; the question is whether Ethereum could have kept going since Geth stands out as a possible single point of failure for the network.</p><p>Nethermind powers around 8% of the validators that operate Ethereum, and this weekend's bug was critical enough to pull those validators offline. Ethereum stayed up and running despite the issue, and Nethermind's developers released a patch fixing things within hours. The main consequence of the bug was that modest financial penalties fell onto some Nethermind-based validators.</p><p>Around 85% of Ethereum's validators are currently powered by Geth, and the recent outages to smaller execution clients have renewed concerns that Geth's dominant market position could pose grave consequences if there were ever issues with its programming.</p><p>Depending on the nature of the bug, a Geth glitch could halt the entire network, rendering it impossible for validators to add new blocks to the blockchain. Ethereum is also programmed to penalize validators that fall offline or break the network's rules, meaning thousands of Geth-based validators could be held financially liable in the event of a bug, and the penalties could get even bigger if the bug proves difficult to patch.</p>",
            "image_url": "https://s2.tokeninsight.com/static/news/cover/img/eth_staking2.png",
            "url": "https://tokeninsight.com/en/news/8-ethereum-validators-went-down-on-sunday-sparking-worries-on-client-diversity?utm_source=public&utm_medium=api&utm_campaign="
          },

            "timestamp": 1705977114000,
            "title": "EigenLayer Plans Shared Security Model, Re-stakes to be Used For All Network Services",
            "content": "<p>Reported by The Block, re-staking protocol EigenLayer plans to adopt a \"shared security\" system, a mechanism allowing protocols to join the network by leveraging a common pool of ETH stakes.</p><p>EigenLayer offers a protocol for users to deposit and \"re-stake\" ether from various liquid staking tokens, aiming to allocate those funds to secure third-party networks. The project's first stage was released on the Ethereum mainnet in June 2023.</p><p>In the future, the team intends to nudge the project into a major decentralized application platform and enable other projects to launch, leveraging the so-called shared security.</p><p>That version will enable the amount of ETH re-stakes on EigenLayer — currently over $1.7 billion — to be supplied to all services developed on the network simultaneously for the sake of a common security mechanism. This would make it economically unviable for an attacker to take down any given protocol.</p>",
            "image_url": "https://s2.tokeninsight.com/static/news/cover/img/EL.png",
            "url": "https://tokeninsight.com/en/news/eigenlayer-plans-shared-security-model-re-stakes-to-be-used-for-all-network-services?utm_source=public&utm_medium=api&utm_campaign="

            "content": "<p><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tokeninsight.com/en/coins/deri-protocol/overview\">Deri Protocol </a>has announced the launch of Gamma Swap, a new financial instrument that allows buyers to obtain Gamma exposure of an underlying asset, while sellers can earn funding fees for providing that exposure. The platform offers perpetual futures, perpetual options and Power Perpetual, which allows users to trade an index of asset prices and hedge against impermanent losses.           {
            "timestamp": 1700554673000,
            "title": "Equation: Unveiling the Future Potential of AMM Models in Derivatives Trading ",
            "content": "<p>Cryptocurrency derivatives trading has become integral to the crypto space, with perpetual contracts overwhelmingly dominating the derivatives landscape, both on and off-chain. On-chain derivative trading protocols have mainly evolved in two directions: one follows the centralized exchange (CEX) order book model, facing challenges about sacrificing decentralization for a seamless trading experience. The other, exemplified by the GMX-based GLP fund pool model, operates as a lending model where Liquidity Providers (LP) lend funds for user positions, resulting in LP losses if users profit. While this model simplifies the user experience, it limits the trader's position size to the LP fund pool and exposes LPs to significant losses in a one-sided market.</p><p>Equation, a decentralized perpetual contract protocol based on Arbitrum, combines the advantages of decentralized, efficient, and transparent features similar to spot Automated Market Makers (AMM). It excels in price discovery for perpetual contract products, significantly enhancing capital efficiency.</p><p>Equation, audited by third-party auditor ABDK, utilizes the innovative Balanced Rate Market Maker (BRMM) model. This model allows traders to establish larger and unrestricted positions with lower liquidation risk (MMR = 0.25%), leveraging up to 200x. Simultaneously, liquidity providers can enhance capital efficiency by using leverage on Equation.</p><p>Launched on the Arbitrum mainnet on October 28, 2023, Equation swiftly climbed to the 13th position among 162 on-chain derivative exchanges, according to DefiLlama data on the day of writing.</p><figure class=\"image\"><img src=\"https://s2.tokeninsight.com/static/calendar/img20231121041535f1760a20-0688-49ab-99e5-3376ed0d2237.jpg\"></figure><p>Equation's BRMM model, inspired by the spot market AMM mechanism, calculates the balance rate of the liquidity pool based on the temporary position ratio held by liquidity providers. This rate is then used to determine the contract price's premium relative to the index price, facilitating price discovery. As a genuine perpetual contract mechanism, users' position sizes are not restricted by liquidity pool, depending solely on the counterparty's scale. The liquidity provided by LPs acts only as temporary counterparty liquidity, thus facing temporary position risk.</p><p>On the 24th day after the mainnet launch, Equation achieved a leverage liquidity of $596,584,794 within the protocol, with a perpetual contract trading volume of $296 million and an open interest of $76,183,194.</p><p><strong>Fair Launch and Burn Mechanism:</strong></p><p>Equation's native token is EQU, with a maximum supply of 10 million. The entire supply is generated through position mining, liquidity mining, and referral mining, rewarding the community. Currently, 224,877 EQU tokens have been mined, and they are listed on major decentralized exchanges.</p><p>Equation allocates 50% of the tokens to traders through position mining. LPs, benefiting from increased capital utilization through leverage and capturing more trading fees, also find this distribution method favorable.</p><figure class=\"image\"><img src=\"https://s2.tokeninsight.com/static/calendar/img20231121041536440497fc-339f-42ab-9c6b-5d463bf02f92.jpg\"></figure><p>Equation offers two staking mining modes using EQU: EQU/ETH LP NFT staking mining and EQU single-token mining, both with different lock-up periods. Presently, 159,872 EQU are staked, indicating confidence in the project's development, typically correlating with a positive view and longer token holding periods.</p><figure class=\"image\"><img src=\"https://s2.tokeninsight.com/static/calendar/img20231121041536dc4bfd8f-3149-41b2-8856-ce7f1250d182.jpg\"></figure><p>Recently, Equation DAO approved a proposal suggesting proportional burning of a portion of EQU not used for long-term staking, aiming to potentially increase the value of assets held by EQU holders. This strategy further encourages and rewards long-term investments in the ecosystem.</p><p>In the decentralized perpetual contract space, factors like trading costs, position limits, liquidity pool depth, and maintenance margin directly influence the trading experience. Equation enhances the trader's perception of cost-effective trading services through measures such as funding rates, fee discounts, and holding mining. For liquidity providers, the variance in capital utilization efficiency offered by DEXs directly determines where they allocate their capital. Equation, by not directly making LPs the counterparties in trades, enables LPs to use less capital to earn more trading fees and token (EQU) rewards, making it an attractive choice for LPs.</p><p>BRMM successfully addresses the challenges of low capital utilization and poor trading experience exhibited by the AMM model in the application of decentralized perpetual contract products.</p><p>As one of the DeFi protocols advocating for a \"fair launch,\" Equation is actively showcasing how community-driven innovation shapes the future of decentralized finance. Prioritizing security and transparency, it aims to provide traders with a reliable and secure perpetual contract trading environment.</p><p>Website: <a rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\" target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.equation.org/\">Equation</a>&nbsp;</p><p>Twitter: <a rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\" target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://twitter.com/EquationDAO\">EquationDAO</a></p>",
            "image_url": "https://s2.tokeninsight.com/static/news/cover/img/equation.png",
            "url": "https://tokeninsight.com/en/news/equation-unveiling-the-future-potential-of-amm-models-in-derivatives-trading?utm_source=public&utm_medium=api&utm_campaign="
          }
        ],

        "review_time": 1694314701000,

          "Derivatives",
          "DEX",
          "AMM"

            "timestamp": 1705980271000,
            "title": "8% Ethereum Validators Went Down on Sunday, Sparking Worries on Client Diversity",
            "content": "<p>Reported by Coindesk, a bug in Ethereum's Nethermind client software – used by validators of the blockchain to interact with the network – knocked out a chunk of the chain's key operators on Sunday.</p><p>It was a manageable incident, but the episode revived a long-simmering debate in the Ethereum ecosystem around the need for \"client diversity.\" Some experts took the opportunity to point out how bad things could have been if another client software, Geth, the chain's most popular execution client, had gone out; the question is whether Ethereum could have kept going since Geth stands out as a possible single point of failure for the network.</p><p>Nethermind powers around 8% of the validators that operate Ethereum, and this weekend's bug was critical enough to pull those validators offline. Ethereum stayed up and running despite the issue, and Nethermind's developers released a patch fixing things within hours. The main consequence of the bug was that modest financial penalties fell onto some Nethermind-based validators.</p><p>Around 85% of Ethereum's validators are currently powered by Geth, and the recent outages to smaller execution clients have renewed concerns that Geth's dominant market position could pose grave consequences if there were ever issues with its programming.</p><p>Depending on the nature of the bug, a Geth glitch could halt the entire network, rendering it impossible for validators to add new blocks to the blockchain. Ethereum is also programmed to penalize validators that fall offline or break the network's rules, meaning thousands of Geth-based validators could be held financially liable in the event of a bug, and the penalties could get even bigger if the bug proves difficult to patch.</p>",

The project's first stage was released on the Ethereum mainnet in June 2023.</p><p>In the future, the team intends to nudge the project into a major decentralized application platform and enable other projects to launch, leveraging the so-called shared security.</p><p>That version will enable the amount of ETH re-stakes on EigenLayer — currently over $1.7 billion — to be supplied to all services developed on the network simultaneously for the sake of a common security mechanism.
